Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She lives with her husband who works in the same business. They live in their own home built of brick and cement, with a roof of corrugated metal sheets and wood floor.  They have drinking water, electricity, gas and sewage.

Her business is making traditional shoes and boots used in various folk dances, such as, “caporales”, “morenada” and “diablada”, among others. “I started working at a very young age because my family used to work in this business, now I work with my husband” she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers, the disadvantage is the lack of money to buy production materials, such as, leather, fabric, soles and others.

Her dream is to hire people to help manufacture in wholesale, she wants to buy shoe production materials. This is her 2nd loan cycle with this institution in the 35 years that she has been working. For these reasons, Wilma requests a loan to buy shoe production materials, hire personnel and sell wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase shoe production materials, hire personnel and sell wholesale.

loans.name: Sitan's Group

texts.fr: Sitan qui se trouve détenant la photo de myAgro sur papier en main, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Zamblebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Sitan, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 2 enfants âgés de 2 à 4 ans, et dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille a incité Sitan à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 3 ans. Sitan cultive l'arachide, le mil, le riz. Sitan entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants. Cette année Sitan effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 3 ans que Sitan cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Sitan planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de chevres et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Sitan espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants
texts.en:
Sitan, who is holding a myAgro photo in her hands, is a member of a group of four farmers, registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of  Zamblebougou in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Aged 45, Sitan is the mother of two children aged 2 and 4, of whom one is presently enrolled in school. Agriculture permits her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family and that has prompted Sitan to work in this field for three years now. 

Sitan grows peanuts, millet, and rice. She is beginning her first year with myAgro, and she registered hoping to be able to increase her yield through the services proposed by myAgro and because of the positive image of myAgro in neighboring villages. 

This year Sitan is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts so as to increase her yield on her plot of  0.0625 hectares. Sitan has been growing peanuts for three years now because of their money-earning potential. With the increase in her yield and her income, she plans to raise livestock such as goats and to buy agricultural supplies. Finally, Sitan hopes to ensure food self-sufficiency for her family and also to pay for the weddings of her children.

loans.use: to buy herself an OPV package of seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Darwin  David

texts.es:
Darwin es un joven de veinte y un años de edad, que decidió estudiar la licenciatura en enfermería, por la pasión que le inculco su madre la cual tiene mucho tiempo siendo enfermera y le ha enseñado a su hijo el placer de ayudar a los enfermos. Poco a poco ha salido adelante en su camino académico, poniendo todo su esfuerzo para llegar a convertirse en un buen trabajador de la salud.
En estos momentos se encuentra en su penúltimo año de su carrera universitaria, ha solicitado la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar elementos médicos que le demandan sus clases, además de una computadora que le brinde agilidad  y calidad para la entrega de sus trabajos. En un futuro desea primero que nada encontrar un trabajo que le permita sacar adelante a su familia y luego estudiar para ser médico.
texts.en:
Darwin, age 21, decided to study for a nursing degree because of the passion that his mother instilled in him.  She has been a nurse for a long time, and she has taught her son the pleasure of helping sick people.  Little by little he has been getting ahead on his academic path.  He is putting all of his efforts into becoming a good health worker.

He is now in his penultimate year of his university studies.  He has requested the help of Kiva together with MiCrédito to grant him a loan that will allow him to buy medical materials that his classes demand.  He will also buy a computer to provide agility and quality to the delivery of his work.

In the future he wishes more than anything to find a job that will allow him to get his family ahead and to later study to be a doctor.

loans.use: to buy medical materials that his classes demand and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Liney Isabel

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tener un negocio sostenible son los grandes sueños de Liney, que con su negocio de tienda escolar intenta ganarse la vida día a día.

Tiene este negocio gracias a la Institución educativa que le permite trabajarlo 5 días a la semana.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar ingredientes como harina, queso, pollo, carne, maíz, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros, para abastecer su tienda y tener mejor inventario.

Esto le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Liney’s two greatest dreams are to improve the conditions of her home and to have a sustainable business. With her school concession stand business she tries to earn a living every day.

She has this business thanks to the educational institution that allows her to work 5 days a week. 

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like flour, cheese, chicken, meat, corn, candy, drinks, etc., to be able to stock up her store and have better inventory.

This will enable her to increase her sales and have a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cheese, chicken, meat, corn, candy, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en el 4to ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. Todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
La Sra. Gloria, es una  las integrantes quien en su más reciente encuesta mostró una gran mejora, todo esto gracias a su esfuerzo y a su sacrificio. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que viene luchando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna, se dedica a las ventas ya que tiene una despensa.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, verduras, carne, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Group is in its 4th cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank Program, where they are developing teamwork and mutual support. They are all part of the Elimination of Poverty Program, which helps them to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families. 

Señora Gloria is one of the members who showed a huge improvement in her most recent survey; all thanks to her effort and sacrifice.  She is a very hardworking person who has been fighting to be able to give her family all that they need for a decent life. She makes a living through sales, as she has a grocery store.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase fruit, vegetables, meat, baked goods, and other things, so that she can continue working as she has been.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables, meat, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Elva Del Pilar

texts.es:
Elva tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural ubicada en el distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma en su domicilio, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de pescado, papas, cebolla, entre otros insumos para la elaboración de sus alimentos, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elva is 35 years old, is married, and lives in her family's house in a rural part of the Nueva Arica district, in the Ciclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The habitants of this region primarily work in agriculture, commerce, and animal farming.

Elva makes a living selling food, which she prepares in her home. She has been doing this work for 3 years, so she has experience in this business and good personal and professional references in her district. She is requesting a loan to buy fish, potatoes, onions, and other consumables for her food production business. Ultimately she hopes to grow her business and satisfy the needs of her customers, which will generate more income and enable her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish, potatoes, onions, and other consumables for her food production business.

loans.name: Mira 3 Group

texts.en:
Zeina is the featured borrower of Maro 3 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a group loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they work hard to develop their family's living and businesses at the same time.

Zeina is the lady at the far right side of the picture; she is a 27-year-old married mother of three children who has been running her business from her house since 2010. With her business, she makes sure she can take good care of her family members and customers at the same time. She also provides hairdressing services to customers in their homes upon request to make them feel more comfortable.

Today, since Zeina's business income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover their family's necessary living needs, Zeina's acquired loan will be invested in buying a refrigerator for her house, which is necessary to keep her family's food healthy and fresh.

As for the other group members, Mariam is the lady at the far left side of the picture with a black and white veil covering her hair, and Dunia is the lady sitting at the center of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a needed refrigerator for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Irbin Florencia

texts.es: Doña Irbin, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, reside en un sector del municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Anteriormente trabajo en una maquila y hace 3 años decidió poner su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan, churros, productos de higiene y limpieza, productos enlatados, harina y otros abarrotes. Además esta iniciando con otra actividad de elaboración de tajadas para la venta. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras con el fin de surtir de productos como arroz, frijoles, harina, lácteos, refrescos, churros y con una parte va cancelar un saldo pendiente de una deuda. con esta inversión espera mejorar las ventas y los ingresos. Su plan es continuar son su negocio, aumentar los clientes y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Irbin is 49 years old. She is a single mother and has two dependent children.  She resides in the municipality of Progreso, Yoro.

Previously, she used to work in an assembly plant. 3 years ago, she decided to start her own business of general food store that sells basic goods for the family, such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, churros, hygiene and cleaning products, canned products, flour, and other groceries.  In addition to this, she is starting another business of making and selling tajadas (Honduran food made of plantanes). 

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras, for the purpose of supplying products such as rice, beans, flour, dairy, beverages, churros; and partially of canceling a pending loan. With this investment, she hopes to improve her sales as well as income. 

Her plan is to continue with her business, increase customers, and support her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, flour, dairy, beverages and churros; to repay a small pending debt

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana vive en casa propia con su hija, ella recibe remesas familiares y de su esposo y con esa ayuda es como puede salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el piso ya que esta muy deteriorado, pero con la ayuda que recibe no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de piso cerámico, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda digna para su hijo.
texts.en: Ana lives in her own house with her daughter. She receives remittances from relatives and from her husband, and she is able to get along with this help. She wants to improve her house by replacing the floor, as it is badly deteriorated, but she cannot manage to do this with the help that she receives. That is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of floor tiles, sand, and payment for labor. In this way, she will be able to have a decent house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase floor tiles, cement, and sand, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. 
Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 

Desde hace 11 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas sola.

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor como tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Mary manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mary is a woman dedicated to her family and her work. 

Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead, getting through various obstacles that have come her way.
She started her own business, a beauty salon, 11 years ago. It is located in an area of the house she lives in. She also provides service at her customers’ homes, depending on what they need. 

She works on her own every day for 8 hours. 

This allows her to make enough money to help her husband out with the responsibility of their home finances. 

She will invest the loan she is requesting into buying a hair dryer and wholesale supplies such as hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polishes, etc. This will allow her to continue working and offering more complete service to her customers, in a more flexible and efficient way, which will increase the profit margin she earns for her work.

Mary says her greatest longing is to be able to continue with her work, to strengthen her business and position it in her area so that she can become more competitive in the market and have the ability to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: buy a hair dryer and wholesale supplies such as hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polishes, etc.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 25 year-old single man who started working in prospecting for mines to cover his needs and expenses, two years ago 

He is a hard worker and ambitious young man who is always trying to improve his living conditions.

Today, Maher is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start his own car spare parts selling business. 

He hopes to open his own shop in the future to increase his income and build his future.

loans.use: to start selling car spare parts.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie, 32, is a married with two children; one attends school. He is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ronie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more rice to resell.

Ronie has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ronie would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Delcy Maria

texts.es:
Delcy, de 49 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de venta de comestibles en una chaza cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Chinu, en este negocio vende pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Delcy trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar sus ventas. Enfrenta múltiples dificultades como el costo de los insumos, la competencia en el sector y las fuertes lluvias que azotan su puesto de trabajo.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, productos de dulceria, golosinas, entre otros.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delcy, aged 49, has decided to set up a business selling food from a stall near to her home in the town of Chinu. She sells traditional colombian chicken pies, empanadas, buñuelos among other things. Delcy works every day from 6 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. She is a very responsible, sensible woman who works very hard for her business.

Among her unrealized dreams is to be able to pay for her children's educations and to increase her sales. She is faced with many difficulties, such as the cost of ingredients, competition in the sector and the strong rains that beat down on her place of work.

She is requesting economic support to invest in her business and to buy ingredients such as chicken, oil, flour, confectionery products and candies. The loan will have a very positive impact on her life and her business, as she will be able to realize her dream and will have a a better variety of foods to offer to her customers, and her children also depend on this business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, oil, flour, confectionery products and candies.

loans.name: Ana Marlevis

texts.es:
Ana, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para su hijo de 4 años, inicio con un negocio de tratamientos estéticos prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Sincelejo, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de un equipo para gimnasia pasiva, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Ana a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
Ana, in her tireless search for a better life and economic stability for her 4-year-old son, started her own cosmetics business. She provides a delivery service in the Sincelejo municipality, a place where drive and perseverance are an important model for its residents. 

Ana works every day with varied hours, and always is busy with some service since her business is very in demand. 

She is requesting economic assistance to buy passive exercise equipment, so that she may provide a better service and keep her business afloat. Currently she is happy for the good work that she has carried out so far, which has given her the pleasure of having stable employment. 

With this loan you can help Ana continue with her life's project!

loans.use: to buy passive exercise equipment, so that she may provide a better service.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is a farmer with two children living in Taing Khlai Village. As a widow, looking after her children had not been easy. She farms in the early morning. 

Now her children work in Phnom Penh and send money to her every month. Currently she has less burden to carry but still works on her farm. 

At her age, Im wants to live in a comfortable house. She has difficulty using a battery for home energy.  She needs to recharge her battery every week. 

She decided to apply for a KIVA loan to buy solar home energy system. Im believes solar energy can enhance her lifestyle in a comfortable manner.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Taing Khlai Village, Svay Chirj commune, Samaki Me

loans.name: Nifilia

texts.en:
Nifilia, a diligent and hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, to increase her inventory. 

She wants to purchase grocery items for her store. 

This way, Nifilia will be able to sell more goods, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 43 years old woman who she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has worked in the public sector for many years.

Sajida provides sewing services and earn the income to help her household.

Sajida needs needles, threads, clothes, machine oil and more for her business. But due to insufficient funds she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore Sajida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase sewing supplies. She hopes this will help her increase her monthly sales and profit.

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Bright Academy School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godfrey. He is the chairperson of Bright Academy School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 537 students. 

Bright School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bright School will repay their loan with school fees collected each term. 

Godfrey hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system for students.

loans.name: Kimhak

texts.en:
Kimhak, a farmer and also part time job worker in a company, lives in Kraing Skea Village with a wife and one little child. 

He wants to expand his business with 4 hectares of big land and help his family to live in comfortable conditions. However, his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge a car battery every two or three days for daily usage. Sometimes, because of busyness, he doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family is in a pitch black condition. 

Moreover, he is always concerned about his only child's safety when he and his wife go to do farming. There is no one at home and the car battery is a power source that has acid, a dangerous substance. He's afraid an accident may happen because of his innocent child's playful actions. 

As a result, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition will be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home energy

location.town: Kraing Skea Village, Kraing Skea Commune, Toek Pho

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 45 years old, married and had three children. One attends school. Her spouse works in Manila as a laborer. 

She wanted to improve her sales and profits, so she needs additional capital for her business. She also open-up a business selling cured pork. She is now asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, and eggs to sell in her store. She will also buy meat. 

Edna would like to fully establish her cured-pork selling business for additional profits, and someday achieve financial stability. She will also save revenue for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and meat.

loans.name: Roberto Leodan

texts.es: Roberto de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz, una actividad en la que posee 20 años de experiencia, Roberto posee una parcela la cual es propicia para la siembra, la que le permite contar con muy buenas cosechas, lo que desea aprovechar al máximo duplicando la cantidad de maíz que siembra, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL y de esta forma comprar semillas, abono y pesticidas, el un hombre muy trabajador quien vela por una mejora vida para su familia por lo que deposita sus esperanzas en dicho préstamo.
texts.en: Roberto, age 33, lives in his own house with his wife and his three children. He grows corn, an occupation in which he has 20 years’ experience.  Roberto owns a plot of land that is good for planting, which helps him to have very good harvests.  He wants to make full use of it by planting twice the amount of corn, so he is requesting a loan with INTEGRAL in order to purchase seed, compost, and pesticide. He is a very hardworking man who strives for a better life for his family, so he is pinning his hopes on this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seed, compost, and pesticide.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 47 years old with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has sold crude salt for the past 21 years. Apart from salt, Agnes also bakes bread and pancakes for extra income. 

Agnes has a dream of educating her children so they can attain a brighter future and become rich. 

Agnes is a hard-working woman asking for support to enable her grow her business. She is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Agnes requests a loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros operates a motor transport business and her husband is the driver. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a good income every day, from which she supports her family's needs. 

To continue her business, Milagros availed herself of a loan to pay for a motor unit. This is intended to expand her business and make way for another opportunity to other business activities. 

She hopes to own more motor units and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for a motor unit for her motor transport business

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
Anam is 25 years old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Anam has run a beauty salon for the past year. Her husband owns a printing shop. 

She needs to buy supplies, like cosmetics, creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business. 

Therefore, Anam has applied for a Kiva loan to buy salon supplies so she can provide better services to her customers. The loan will help her earn maximum profits to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Anam is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy salon supplies.

loans.name: 040305060003 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lộc works in agriculture raising poultry. Lộc has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lộc is 52 years old and is married with two children. Lộc is the group leader of the 040305060003 Quảng Hưng Solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lộc joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lộc has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The main hardship that Lộc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lộc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida runs and operates a tin machine and caters services like repairs of tinware or items of other light metals. In addition to that, she also engages in raising and selling of hogs. She is a 65-year-old married woman with three grown children. She resides in Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like tin and many others, which are being used to repair tin and tinware items. These materials are very essential in augmenting her business. Thus, it would improve her income and help her be able to handle her finances.

Placida hopes that her sources of income will become productive and will lead her to sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy materials like tin and many others.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette, 38, is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Janette has two children who attend school.

Janette has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Janette has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to adopt modern farming technology.

loans.name: Ivan Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Ivan tiene gran experiencia en el área de cocina, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia salsamentaria que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.
Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm
Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar la compra de sillas y mesas para atender de una mejor forma a sus clientes.
El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran restaurante.
Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada teniendo en cuenta que para este tipo de negocios se necesitan algunas condiciones especiales.
texts.en:
Ivan has lots of experience in matters of the kitchen. Some time ago, he launched his own 'salsamentaria' (salsa cafeteria) and, now, he has generated very good results.

Ivan has always preferred to work independently. He works every day from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm.

At present, he needs help to be able to buy chairs and tables to better attend to his customers. The loan will permit him to work in better conditions and to guarantee the quality of his preparations.

Ivan's biggest dream is to, one day, have a grand restaurant. With this help, he can work in a more organized manner, taking into account the fact that for this type of business, one needs some special conditions.

loans.use: buy chairs and tables to better attend to his customers.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 45 year old divorced woman. She lives with her pensioner father in the Zugdidi district. 

Inga is unemployed and has no source of income. She wants to start trading business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2000 USD. 

With the loan Inga will start trading dishes to generate a stable income. 

Inga is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading dishes.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural dedicada a la crianza de animales y comercio que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería como peón agrícola, contando con herramientas propias como una mochila para fumigar, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a sus herramientas de trabajo ya que se encuentran en mal estado, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio, el espera mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is aged 26 and has a partner and one child. He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, a rural area where the principle industries are animal farming and commerce. It is situated in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He offers his services as a day laborer, working as a farm hand with his own tools such as a fumigation backpack. He has more than 5 years experience working in this business and has many permanent clients who offer very good personal and professional references. 

He is requesting a loan to repair and maintain his work tools which are now in a poor state. This will allow him to keep his equipment and tools in a better condition, which will greatly affect his work, as he hopes to increase his productivity and meet the diverse needs of his clients throughout the area. This will increase his income and allow him to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his tools which are in poor condition.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 57 year-old married mother of two children who has run her convenience store since August 2012.

Hiyam is well known in her region and has a good reputation. She also offers special products.

She is working hard to expand and develop her business, but unfortunately, her increasing living expenses forbid her from taking this step forward.

Today, Hiyam took the first step towards developing and increasing her business capital through a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. Doing so will enable her to increase her merchandise with special summer beverages and special offer items.

Hiyam hopes to move to a wider shop to display a greater range of foodstuff and home products.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages.

loans.name: Adiela Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Adiela desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital arreglando sus corrales y comprando productos para engorde y levante de ganado.

Es madre responsable y amorosa con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposo quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en:
Adiela has done farm work and raised animals since she was a little girl. Her father taught her this work so that she would be able to get by in life.

Today her main work is agriculture and raising animals. Her goal is to improve her resources by fixing the corrals and buying products to raise and fatten up cattle. 

She is the loving and responsible mother of two children. She lives on a farm with her children and husband, who has been her greatest company.

She dreams of being able to provide her children with a quality education so that later they can get by on their own and be independent.

She tends to her business every day and makes sure things are going well and knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar she will go far.

loans.use: to fix the corrals and buy products to raise and fatten up cattle.

loans.name: Yukabeth

texts.en:
Yucabeth is 53 years old, married and supports a family of seven members. She has been practicing vegetable sales in the market for the last six years earning KES8,000 per month. 

Yucabeth has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy vegetables for sale in the market to meet the customers` demand. 

She plans to use her anticipated profits to educate her children and to open a retail shop. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be business-oriented. 

Nancy operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are individuals. 

Nancy will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Arnold Enrique

texts.es:
Arnold, un campesino muy trabajor y de gran pasión por la naturaleza, trabaja con animales, pero no sacrificándolos ni vendiéndolos solamente, trabaja con la leche de las vacas; es tanta la admiración y respeto por los animales que prefiere que mueran por vejez antes de tener que sacrificarles para conseguir una rentabilidad por su carne. 
Es padre de 1 hijo, y le enseña la pasión por el campo, por amar la naturaleza y el amor por los animales. 

Pensando en su vivienda y en sus hijos el señor Arnold quiere expandirse y por tal motivo tiene un dinero juntado para comprar una vaca lechera por lo que requiere un crédito para ajustar el total del dinero para la compra de la vaca. 

Con la ayuda de esta vaca tendrá más producción lechera garantizando una vida económica estable para el futuro de el y su hijo. 

Sueña con tener una finca con mucho ganado rodearse de estos mamíferos que le ayudan a llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Arnold is a very hardworking farmer and his biggest passion is for nature, working with animals, but not sacrificing or selling them solely, but working with the milk of the cows. He has such admiration and respect for the animals and prefers them to die of old age than have them sacrificed to get a return for their meat.

He is a father of one son, and teaches them a passion for the field, for love of nature, and love of the animals.

Thinking about his home and his son, Arnold wants to expand and for this reason has saved money to purchase a milking cow. He requires a loan to help offset the total for the purchase of the cow.

With the help of this cow he will have more milk production to ensure a stable economic life for the future of him and his son.

His dream is to have a farm with many cattle, surrounding himself with these mammals that help bring sustenance to his family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, rice, milk, cooking oil and soap detergents to sell.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be humble and generous. 

She runs a retail clothes selling business and has been in operation for 12 years. It is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. 

Peninah says her biggest business challenge is a lack of enough space . She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more clothes and pay rent for the business premise. 

Her business goal is to have a big clothing mall within five years. She hopes to expand her business and educate her children to university level. 

This is Peninah's eighth loan with SMEP micro-finance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and pay rent.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending. Lilia is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell.

Lilia has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Liliana es una mujer de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Urrao con sus dos hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de comidas rápidas.
 
Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas sola
Ella ofrece sus productos en un carro de comidas cuando un cliente le hace un pedido, intenta satisfacer su necesidad a toda cabalidad. 
Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su edad.

Ella solicita un préstamo para compra de surtido de carne, queso, jamón, pan , entre otros.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana is a woman who has fought a thousand battles throughout her life, she lives in the town of Urrao with her two children.

She is a very hardworking woman and has worked for a while selling fast food. She works for just 5 hours every day.

She sells her products from a food cart. When a customer makes an order, she tries to successfully satisfy their needs. She expresses that it is a business which is easy to carry out at her age.

She is requesting a loan to buy a selection of meat, cheese, ham and bread, among other things. The loan will give her the opportunity to improve her business and give a considerable boost to the activity, allowing her to earn resources for her children's university.

loans.use: to buy a selection of meat, cheese, ham, bread and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and maize seeds for improved farming activity so as to get a better harvest for both client and family use.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 29-year-old single Palestinian Refugee, who has lived in a Palestinian camp since he was born. 

Ashraf runs his photography business from his house as a cameraman handling most of the wedding and special occasions taking place inside and outside the camp.

Ashraf is the sole breadwinner for another member of his family, and that's why he works hard to develop his business so that his income will improve gradually.

Today, and since his income currently barely covers his family's living needs, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary maintenance to his house after the hard winter season they have witnessed in his region. This will keep his house safe and healthy as well as suitable for running his business until he is financially capable of opening a separate studio, a dream he is longing to make true.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his house after the hard winter season they faced in their camp

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29 year old married man with three children, who are ages four, three and one.  

He runs a retail business and supplements his family income with agriculture. He works five days a week and eight hours daily.
Paul started his business in 2006 with the aim of getting more money to increase family income since agriculture could not cover his family's expenses. 

Paul has acquired this loan in order to purchase stock for his retail shop; items such as rice, sugar, bread, corn flour, soda, toiletries among other items.

His clients are traders from surrounding towns and his dream is to be the leading supplier of all products in his area. But his biggest challenge is a lack of capital and price fluctuations.

Paul describes himself as a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Ada Maria

texts.es:
El aprendizaje de Ada en distintas instituciones, la llevó a evolucionar y emprender en su propio negocio para salir adelante con sus seis hijos, jóvenes y adultos que ahora son el apoyo incondicional para ella. Con más de diez años como comerciante de accesorios para uso personal y venta de papas, esta trabajadora de 53 años de edad se siente muy contenta por haber tomado la decisión de independizarse hace algunos años y convertirse en una pequeña empresaria.
Ada además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y obtiene otras ganancias alquilando una casa, lo que indica lo visionaria que es esta emprendedora. Característica que la llevó a solicitar un préstamo para comprar camisas, zapatos, fajas y perfumes para vender y así ofrecer una variedad a sus clientes. En sus planes está seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que siga creciendo hasta establecerse en un local fijo.
texts.en:
Ada’s education at various institutions led her to develop and start her own business in order to get ahead along with her six children, young and adult, who are now her unconditional support. With ten years as a vendor of personal-use accessories and potatoes, this hardworking lady, age 53, feels very happy about making the decision some years ago to become an independent small businesswoman.

In addition, Ada has her husband’s support, and she obtains extra earnings by renting out a house, which indicates how visionary this lady entrepreneur is.  This characteristic led her to request a loan to purchase shirts, shoes, belts, and perfumes to sell, and thus offer a variety to her customers. Her plans include continuing to invest in her business, so that it may continue growing until it is established in a permanent store.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, shoes, belts, and perfumes.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 49 years old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one daughter and four sons, her husband has been a cattle farmer for the past 25 years.

Neelam is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.

Neelam's husband wants to purchase animals for his business, but due to financial constraints is unable to purchase cattle.

Therefore Neelam has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan to enable her husband to buy cattle to fulfill the needs of his business.

Neelam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's cattle business.

loans.name: Childekan

texts.ru: Чилдекан, 52 года, вдова, мать 4 детей, они активно помогают по хозяйству. Образование у нее среднее, занимается животноводством и полеводством уже 20 лет. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве есть корова, 25 овец. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Чилдекан решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. На прибыль от кредита Чилдекан планирует и дальше развивать ее деятельность, чтобы накопить на постройку жилого дома.
texts.en: Childekan is 52, widowed, and the mother of four children who help her around the farm. She has a high school education and has been raising livestock and planting crops for 20 years. She is very pleasant and kind by nature, also responsible and hardworking. She has a cow and 25 sheep and sells milk on a daily basis. Childekan decided to expand her business and turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to continue expanding her business and to save money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Maderleys

texts.es:
Maderleys, de 21 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea desempeñarse como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, en el municipio de Sincelejo.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor, cosméticos, entre otros y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Maderleys, 21 years old, has it very clear in her mind what she wants in life and she is dedicated to finishing her studies to succeed and to have a good life.

She hopes to work as a seller of varied merchandise, such as clothing, accessories such as wallets, and some cosmetics, among others, in the municipality of Sincelejo.

She wishes to begin this activity with the ambition to look for the resources necessary to support her and to pay for her studies, as well as to be able to contribute to the home expenses.

She is an entrepreneurial and very disciplined woman.

She is requesting the loan to purchase a large supply of clothing wholesale and cosmetics, among others, and in this way take advantage of the opportunity to be independent that the Corporación Interactuar is presenting to her.

She has the hope of being able to progress as a business owner and have a more stable income, and she is thankful to all of the people who can contribute to her dream.

loans.use: to purchase an ample supply of clothing wholesale and cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of merchandise to increase her business’s stock.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposo e hijos en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, los pobladores de esta comunidad se dedican a la crianza de animales y comercio principalmente, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y a la produccion y venta de leche, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años por lo que cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado y alimento para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Irene is 53 years old, with a relationship with her live-in partner. She lives with her husband and children in her own home in a large community in the urban zone of Zaña, and she enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors. The inhabitants of this community mainly make a living from breeding animals and commerce. It is situated in the Chiclayo Province, the Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Irene makes a living from breeding cattle and producing and selling milk. She has performed this activity for more than 10 years, because of which he has steady customers who give her good personal and work references. Her business is located in her own home. She is requesting the loan to purchase a greater quantity of livestock and feed for raising them. In this way, she hopes to make her business grow more, make a higher income, and to be able to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of livestock and feed for raising them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for a much-needed bathroom.

loans.name: Josefina De Las Rosas

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, con 02 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 05 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales así como para realizar arreglos al lugar donde los cría, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Josefina, 43, is married and has two minor children.  The family has a house in Oyotun, a district of Lambayeque along Peru's northern coast.  Farming and small commercial businesses are common means of earning a living here.

Josefina has operated an animal sales business for five years.  She raises and sells poultry: chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc.  She runs the business from a yard at her house.  She is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy more poultry and the rest to build a pen for keeping them.  The investment will allow her to meet local demand for poultry and grow her business.  The extra earnings will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals for her animal sales business and to build a pen for keeping them.

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Maria Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a peanut butter making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Elisa is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making business.

Ma. Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and two daughters.

Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 1 year.  Only her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Parveen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business.

Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothes business

loans.name: Rubia Carolina

texts.es: Rubia, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de El Progreso, Yoro. Rubia siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de mercadería, lleva 4 años de ofrecer lociones, perfumes, cremas, ropa para adultos y niños, cosméticos y carteras. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos, y es su única fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar lociones y ropa variada para vender. Considera que al tener mas producto sus ventas y clientes van a aumentar. Su meta es lograr que sus hijos se gradúen y lograr establecer su tienda en lugar fijo.
texts.en: Rubia, 39, is a single mother with 3 children.  The family lives in Yoro, a small town in El Progreso.  Rubia has operated a retail business for 4 years.  She sells clothing, for both children and adults, lotions, creams, cosmetics, purses and other merchandise.  She works as a street vendor, going block to block, and also sells merchandise to order.  The business is her sole means of supporting her family.  Rubia is applying for a 15,000-lempira loan that she will use to buy clothing and lotions for resale.  The investment, she says, will allow her to stock more products and grow her business.  Her goals for the future are to set up a shop of her own and see her children finish school.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tree for timber production to sell to gain more income

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old, married and blessed with 7 children. She sells timber and has been running the business for 10 years.

She will be using the loan to buy more timber to sell to carpentry workshops and construction sites, and hopes this will enable her to increase her income to support her family.

Rose plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hope is to start small scale farming.

loans.use: to buy more timber to sell to carpentry workshops and construction sites in the hope this will enable her to increase her income to support her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 53, lives with his wife and 3 children in a modest house in Canaris, a district of Lambayeque along Peru's northern coast.  Farming and small commercial businesses are common means of making a living here.

Rodolfo has been a farmer for 10 years.  He grows a variety of coffee called Catimore.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for the labor and supplies--fertilizer, pesticides, etc.--he needs to tend his coffee crop.  The investment will provide the physiological and morphological improvements that will ensure that he maximizes his yields and delivers the best-possible crop.  His earnings from the business will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and supplies he needs to tend his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease more land and expand her farming activity.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 44-year-old married father of five children. Twenty years ago he started transporting goods to cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying desperately to improve his family's living conditions. 

Today, Tareq is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees for he believes that education is the only way to guarantee his children's future.

Tareq hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 42-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of four sons and two daughters. Hasan works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions but his income is barely covering all the family needs.

Hasan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will help him to provide clean water, especially for his kids.

Hasan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house

loans.name: That's Group

texts.en: That is a 45-year-old mother of a child, living in Kampong Thom province. She has been a rice farmer and a paid worker for more than five years and it earns her about 38,900 KHR per day. Due to lack of money to fulfill her needs, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine for her family’s use. She hopes her all family’s members will have good health and a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de cafetería

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de alimentos, un congelador y bebidas.
Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una veterana llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a creative and enterprising woman. For a long time she has wanted to be independent and have her own café.

She is now able to make her dream come true thanks to her great ability to work and the support that she gets from Corporación Interactuar and the people who want to see her get ahead in her business.

Her children will depend on this business. She hopes to teach them about the business and leave them a legacy. She is seeking financial help to buy a selection of foods and drinks and a freezer. 

With this loan you can help an older woman who is full of life and drive for her family!

loans.use: to buy a selection of foods and drinks and a freezer.

loans.name: Mubuku Valley School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Doviko. He is the head teacher of Mubuku Valley Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kasese with 710 students.

Mubuku School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the longterm as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450 litre tanks, which h will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mubuku School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Doviko ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Solteras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Esther María, Verónica  y Nelly Nelia) de la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que lucha día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos, cosméticos y carbón; se organizaron hace aproximadamente tres años para poder accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Esther María: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer sonriente, con cualidades de líder, madre soltera de 1 hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia su cuarto grado de primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que compra en la comunidad miskita cercana a Bilwi que se llama Lamlaya (agua mansa), de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para poder comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. También para diversificar sus productos vender carbón y elaborar nacatamales de jueves a domingos y venderlos a precios accesibles. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women (Esther María, Verónica, and Nelly Nelia) of the Miskita ethnic group of the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are enterprising women who struggle day by day to make their small businesses grow, selling seafood, cosmetics, and coal. They were organized approximately three years ago to be able to access loans with joint guarantee in Pana Pana.

Esther María: 
She is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a smiling woman with leadership qualities and a single mother of an 8-year-old child who is studying his fourth grade in elementary. In order to get her son ahead, for 4 years she has made a living selling fish and seafood which buys in the Miskita community near Bilwi called Lamlaya ("still water"), thus generating her own income and contributing to the household expenses and her son's studies. 

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy more seafood and fish products to sell and increase her income and serve more people requiring these products which are one of the staple goods in Bilwi. Also, to diversify her products, she'll sell coal and make Nicaraguan tamales from Thursday to Sunday and sell them at affordable prices. She dreams of being able to have enough capital to establish a grocery store.

loans.use: to be able to buy more seafood and fish products.

loans.name: Johnoiro

texts.en:
Johnoiro is 61 years old, married to Peninah and supports 15 family members. He has been a farmer for the last 38 years and the business earns him an income of KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and maize seeds for improved farming activity to meet client and family needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. His hope is to be financially stable and start a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and maize seeds for improved farming activity to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en: A 49-year-old father of two children, living in Kampong Thom Province, Oeun is a rice farmer for more than five years and earns about 41,700 KHR per day. He has a purpose to build a private toilet for his family, but he has not enough funds to do so. Now he leads a group to apply for a new loan via VisionFund Cambodia to buy a decent latrine. He hopes this loan will help his family members to have better health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more charcoal, soda, sufurias (cooking pots) and other items to sell

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprometida, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por acoger la población migrante del campo, que forma parte de una gran actividad económica en su mayoría por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Blanca es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la disfruta con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en un puesto de venta al aire libre durante la semana en horas del día. Los juguetes son fabricados con colores vivos. Los más comunes son; automóvil, rompecabezas, cubos, muñecos y otros. “voy ampliar mi negocio abriendo una juguetería…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son contantes, la desventaja es la competencia con los juguetes asiáticos. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de juguetes, ella desea realizar la compra de estantes de exposición para exponer los juguetes a la venta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Blanca solicita un préstamo para la compra de estantes de para exponer los juguetes para abrir una juguetería.
texts.en:
Blanca is 40 years old, she lives with her partner, and she has a 15-year-old son. Her business is selling toys. She is a good mother, and she is enterprising, devoted, kind, responsible, and very hardworking. 

She works on foot in the southern zone of the city.  It is characterized by being home to the large rural immigrant population that forms part of its bustling economic activity, consisting mainly of informal retail trade. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Blanca has tan skin, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears pulled back.  She has a petite stature and a medium build. Her maternal language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish with the general public and for carrying out her business.  She enjoys her life with her partner, who works as a builder, and with her son, who is studying in school. They live in their own home that is built of brick and cement, and has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.

Her business is selling toys, which she carries out on foot in an open air market in the daylight hours during the week. The toys are made with vivid colors. The most common ones are cars, puzzles, blocks, dolls, and others.  “I’m going to expand my business by opening a toy store”, she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales are constant, and the disadvantage is the competition with Asian toys. 

Her dream is to open a toy store, and she wants to purchase display shelves in order to show the toys that are for sale. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work. 

These are the reasons that Blanca is requesting a loan: to purchase shelving to display the toys, in order to open a toy store.

loans.use: to purchase shelves to display the toys, in order to open a toy store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease more land to expand her farming activity.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has nine children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another cow. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy another cow

loans.name: Kadia's Group

texts.fr:
"Kadia qui se trouve sur la photo asseyant au bout et à gauche, est membre d’un groupe de 22 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Congola au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Kadia, âgée de 55 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 12 à 31 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture comme activité génératrice de revenu complétant son travail principal de petit commerce, ont incité Kadia à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Kadia cultive l'arachide, le riz, le gombo sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Elle a partagé que, "sans matériel agricole on ne peut pas avoir beaucoup de revenu." Kadia entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants. Cette année Kadia effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 35 ans que Kadia cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Kadia planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de chevres de diversifier ses cultures comme de sorgho. Enfin Kadia espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants.

Kanta, une membre d'un autre groupe myAgro dans Congola, est aussi pris en photo. Elle est si enthousiaste qu'elle a insisté être dans cette photo aussi.
texts.en:
Kadia, who is sat on the front row at the left of the photo, is a member of a group of 22 farmers registered with myAgro.  She lives and works in the village of Congola in the southwest of Bamako, Mali.  Kadia is 55 years old and the mother of seven children aged between 12 and 31, six of them currently attend school.  

Kadia was encouraged to take part in this activity as farming is a family tradition and has been the main source of income and food for the home. Furthermore, farming is an income-generating activity which supplements her main work in petty trade and she has being doing this for 35 years. 


Kadia grows peanuts, rice and gumbo on her plot but faces farming difficulties like a lack of rain and farming materials.  She has shared her view that without farming materials it is not possible to have a large income.  She is starting her first year with myAgro and registered herself so that she could increase production through the services provided by myAgro and due to the positive image myAgro has within the neighbouring villages.  

This year Kadia is making payments to buy a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow valuable peanuts.  She explains that the peanuts are eaten by the family and used as a sauce base in cooking and also used for their commercial value as they can be sold in the market.  She plans to increase her production and her profit to raise goats in order to diversify the crops like sorghum.  

Essentially Kadia hopes to be able to afford to pay for her children's marriages.  Kanta , a member of another myAgro group in Congola, is also present in the photo.  She is so enthusiastic that she insisted on being in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds to grow peanuts and to increase productivity in her plot.

loans.name: Jiguisèmè Group

texts.fr:
Nassira est la femme qui est entrain d’arroser avec de l’arrosoir.
 Nassira est une paysanne Malienne âgée de 43 ans qui vit  dans le milieu rural avec sa famille.
Elle est mariée. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école à cause des travaux  de la famille car elle est la fille unique de ces parents.
Elle a quatre(4) enfants (3 garçons et 1fille) qui sont scolarisés. Ces enfants sont âgés de 9 à 21 ans.
Son mari fait l’agriculture pour gagner sa vie. Elle fait le maraichage, l’embouche ovine et le petit commerce depuis 18 ans. Elle s’approvisionne toujours dans les marchés locaux et revend dans les mêmes marchés. Elle fait recourt aux services financiers de l’IMF (RMCR) pour soutenir ses activités de maraichage et d’embouche ovine à travers l’achat de semences, d’engrais, médicaments, de moutons maigre et d’aliment bétail.
Le fond qu’elle reçoit du RMCR est investi dans ses activités de maraichage et d’embouche ovine.
Son rêve est d’avoir beaucoup d’animaux domestique tel que (les vaches, les moutons et des chèvres).
