Avec son profit elle arrive à soutenir ces enfants (habillement, nourriture, santé, éducation).
son bénéfice prévisionnel  mensuellement est de 18000FCFA à 20000FCFA.   
Pour améliorer  ses travaux, elle veut avoir beaucoup d’argent pour acheter beaucoup.
texts.en:
Nassira is the woman watering with a watering can in the photo. She is a Malian peasant farmer, 43 years old, who lives in a rural area with her family. She is married. She did not have the chance to go to school due to family work, since she is an only-child of her parents. She has four children (3 boys and a girl) who are provided with schooling. These children are from 8 to 21 years old. Her husband is a farmer to earn his living. 

Nassira operates a market garden, fattens sheep, and runs a small-scale business and has been doing so for eighteen years. She always gets her supplies from the local markets and resells her goods at the same markets. 

She has turned to the financial services of the microfinance institution (RMCR) to support her work in market gardening and fattening sheep through the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, medicines, underweight sheep, and feed. The funds she receives from RMCR are invested in her work. Her dream is to have many domestic animals, such as cows, sheep, and goats. 

With the profits, she manages to support her children (clothing, food, healthcare, education). Her projected monthly profits amount to 18,000 to 20,000 francs CFA. To improve her work, she wants to have much more money to purchase much more.

loans.use: to operate a market garden, fatten sheep, and run a small-scale business

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
Marisol es una mujer de 43 años de edad, viuda, tiene 1 hijo de 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en el sur de su ciudad, área marginada de la ciudad, casas rústicas y antiguas muchas sin acceso a servicios básicos conviven formando un lugar de manufactura y producción en todas las áreas. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Marisol es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la derecha, viste blusa rosada y pantalón negro). Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado.
Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas; Avon, Mary Kay, Jafra y otros…, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante durante toda la semana en diferentes ferias y comercios de la ciudad. Los productos con mayor demanda son; aretes, lápiz labial, cremas anti edad, tratamientos faciales, perfumes, mascara para pestañas, etc. “inicié mi negocio con un capital minimo y poco a poco fui aumentando la mercadería hasta contar con estantes y vitrinas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mayoría de las ventas las realiza a pedido y por catálogo eso hace que no tenga que cargar todos sus productos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para comprar productos por mayor. Su sueño es distribuir cosméticos por mayor, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Esta es la 13 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Marisol solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para convertirse en una distribuidora mayorista.
texts.en:
Marisol, 43, is a widow with a 16-year old son.  She operates a business buying cosmetics that she orders from a catalog and reselling them to her buyers.  She is enterprising, responsible and hard-working.  She built her business in the south of the city, working its poor neighborhoods of modest houses and few services, often cheek and jowl with small factories and other commercial businesses.  It's hot here and day-time temperatures range from 21- to 35-degrees, Centigrade or 70- to 92-degrees, Fahrenheit.  
Marisol is a brown-skinned woman with brown eyes and long, black hair. (In the photo, Marisol is the second woman from the right, in a pink blouse and black pants.)  She speaks Guarani, her native language, and Spanish.  Marisol's son is in school and they live in a modest house of brick and cement.  The house has a metal roof and a cement floor.  They have basic services, as well: water, electricity, sewage.  
Marisol is a street vendor.  She sells beauty products that she buys from Avon, Mary Kay, Jafra and other well-known cosmetics brands.  She works during the week, going from street to street and market to market.  The products that are most in demand, she says, are earrings, lipstick, anti-aging creams, facial treatments, perfumes, mascara, etc.  "I started with very little capital and I've slowly added merchandise", she says.  "Now I have display cases and spaces for displaying my merchandise".  The advantage she has is that she can collect from her buyers before she submits their orders to her suppliers.  Her biggest problem, on the other hand, is that she doesn't have the capital to buy bulk supplies of merchandise at wholesale costs.  She wants to become a wholesaler herself but to do so she will need to stock supplies of the merchandise she sells.
Marisol has operated her business for 10 years and this is her 13th loan.  She will use it to buy bulk supplies of cosmetics and transform her business from retailing to wholesaling.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of cosmetics.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Mbambu est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Bon Berger», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 33 ans, mère 4 enfants dont 3 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires au domicile dans une avenue de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu après récolte dans son champ. Elle va s’approvisionner en 6 sacs de maïs en graine. Elle compte construire sa maison,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mbambu is a merchant and a member of the 'banc villageois' called “Bon Berger”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 33 years old, and the mother of four children, of whom three are students, and one is still very young. 

Mbambu has been a vendor of grocery items in her home on an avenue in town for three years. She began her business with funds after harvesting her field. She is going to stock up with 6 sacks of corn kernels. She is planning on building a house and providing education and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 6 sacks of corn kernels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming through the application of modern farming technology

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: Jeannette est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Aksante Mungu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 29 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés et propriétaire d’une boutique sur la rue de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter de la farine, piles, savon Omo, huiles, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Jeannette is a merchant and a member of the solidarity  group called “Aksante Mungu”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married to a merchant and  29 years old, and she is the mother of five children, of whom four are students, and one is very young. 

Jeannette has been a vendor of various shop goods and the owner of a store on a road in town for five years. She began her business with funds from her husband. She is going to purchase some flour, batteries, Omo soap, oils, etc.  Thus, her wish is to grow her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase flour, batteries, Omo soap, oils, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and tools for farming her farm for better produce so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Zigoti School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is the director of Zigoti Standard Primary School, a mixed school with 500 students in the rural area of Zigoti in Mityana. 

Zigoti School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Zigoti School will repay its loan from the school fees it collects each term. Charles ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: Mabengwa est commerçante, vice président de la banque villageoise «Nuru», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère 9 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt du centre commercial depuis 18 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en 5 sacs d’haricots. Elle souhaite devenir grossiste, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mabengwa is a merchant and the vice-president of the 'banc villageois' called “Nuru”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 38 years old, and the mother of nine children, of whom all are students. 

Mabengwa has been a vendor of grocery items at a commercial center warehouse for eighteen years. She began her business with funds from her husband. She is going to stock up with 5 sacks of beans. Her wish is to become a wholesaler and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 5 sacks of beans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her plants

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred, 46 years old, supports four family members. He has been practicing tea farming for the last 22 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve his farming activity through purchasing fertilizers and maize seedlings for planting.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and start a sustainable retail business . 

His hope is to better his life.

loans.use: to improve his farming activity through purchasing fertilizers and maize seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a shade for her vegetables to prevent them from being destroyed by the sun

loans.name: Lamar1 Group

texts.en:
Hayfaa is the featured borrower of Lamar1 Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbours and seek to improve their businesses and families' living.

Hayfaa is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. She is a 41-year-old married mother of five children, who has been working since January 2015 in her food production business, specializing in mouneh (preserves), that she runs from her house.

Hayfaa has 11 years of experience in this domain and is very skilled, according to her customers' point of view.

Today, and since her her income is barely enough to expand her business according to her ambitions, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials and glass jars to increase her production and develop her business.

As for the other group members, Nour is at the center while Hanadi is at the right side.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials and glass jars to increase her production and develop her business

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr: Mukoelwa est commerçante, trésorière de la banque villageoise «Tuchukuliane», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 10 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle est vendeuse des légumineuses dans un marché de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en légumes (choux, les amarantes, etc.). Elle souhaite devenir grossiste, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mukoelwa is a merchant and the treasurer of the 'banc villageois' called “Tuchukuliane”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 38 years old, and the mother of ten children, of whom all are in school. 

Mukoelwa has been a vendor of vegetables at a town market for twelve years. She began her business with funds from her husband. She is going to stock up with cabbage, amaranth, etc. Her wish is to become a wholesaler and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with vegetables (cabbage, amaranth, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement for sale to meet the needs of her clients for construction materials.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius is a repeat client of Ugafode. She is a single mother of 4 children with 2 attending school. Medius deals in timber trade as her major source of income, a business she has done for over 15 years. However, she has been affected by limited capital to expand her business. To overcome that challenge, she decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance to boost her business. Medius has applied for a loan of ugx4,000,000 to buy more timber to increase her income. 

She praises Ugafode for the financial assistance, which has enabled her to educate her children and sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new stocks of green vegetables, potatoes and fruits

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad is a 44-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father to four sons and one daughter. Nehad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions but his income is barely covering all of the family's needs.

Nehad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will help him to provide clean water, especially for his kids.

Nehad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes and clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizers and maize seeds, for improved farming activity so as to meet her client's and family's needs.

loans.name: Climent

texts.en:
Climent is 60 years old and supports a family of 4 members. 

He has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 16 years earning an income of KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase certified cereal seeds and fertilizers to use in his farming activity to boost production. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: To purchase certified cereal seeds and fertilizers to use in his farming activity to boost production.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is 33 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops to sell for 7 years now. He will be using the loan to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, for use in his farm, and he hopes that this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, for use in his farm and he hopes that this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Puch's Group

texts.en: Puch is a 43-year-old mother of six children, living in Kampong Thom province; she has been a rice farmer and a paid worker for twenty-five years. She could earn about 27,800 KHR per day. To fulfill her wish of building a small private toilet for her family’s use, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will help her family to have better health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 37-year-old widow with three children. She is a primary teacher, a job she has done for 16 years. Florence wanted to build a house but she realized that her salary alone could not enable her to build her house so she joined Ugafode for financial assistance to build the house. She took the first loan to buy bricks and iron sheets which bought and roofed the house, so now she applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy doors and windows for the house. Florence thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled her to construct a house for herself which she could not afford using her salary alone.

loans.use: to buy shutters to complete her house.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 47-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of three sons and two daughters. Tareq works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions but his income is barely covering all the family needs.

Tareq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house. This will help him to provide clean water, especially for his kids.

Tareq appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar water-heating system for his house.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.fr: Mukelo est commerçante, conseillère de la banque communautaire «Umoja ni Nguvu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 48 ans, mère 8 enfants  dont 4 scolarisés et 4 autres n’étudient plus. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais dans un marché de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de ses familiers. Elle va s’approvisionner en 20 kg des poissons. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, acheter une parcelle , construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mukelo is a merchant and the advisor of the community bank called “Umoja ni Nguvu”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is a widow, 48 years old, and the mother of eight children, of whom four are in school, and four are no longer students. 

Mukelo has been a vendor of fresh fish at a town market for eight years. She began her business with funds from people she knows. She is going to stock up with 20 kg of fish. Her wish is to increase her capital, purchase a parcel of land, build [a house], and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 20 kg of fish

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Zeenat is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute along with her husband to manage the household. 

Zeenat needs different kinds of goods, e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Zeenat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of goods, e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her tailoring business

loans.name: Heri Ya Mungu Group

texts.fr: Mapenzi est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Heri ya Mungu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 28 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 1 étudie et 3 sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse des braises dans un marché de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’un crédit. Son conjoint est un enseignant.  Elle va s’approvisionner en 5 sacs de braises. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses  enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Mapenzi is a merchant and a member of the loan group called “Heri ya Mungu”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 28 years old, and the mother of four children, of whom one is a student, and three are very young. 

Mapenzi has been a vendor of charcoal at a town market for six years. She began her business with funds from a loan. He husband is a teacher. She is going to stock up with 5 sacks of charcoal. Her wish is to grow her business and provide schooling and food for her children.

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs. We are eager to indicate that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to stock up with 5 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains (millet, rice, and corn).

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo y reside junto a sus padres en una aldea que pertenece a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura, con los cultivos de maíz, frijoles y café, esta producción es vendida en la misma zona, lo vende húmedo, seco o en uva. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando por 5,000 Lempiras va comprar abonos y fertilizantes para su finca y pago de limpieza, con el fin de mejorar la cosecha próxima. Su sueño a futuro es ampliar el cultivo para obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a su familia con lo que necesita y poder construir su casa.
texts.en: Jose is 28 years old, he is married and has one son. He lives with his parents in a village that belongs to Nueva Frontera, in Santa Barbara. He has several years of experience working in agriculture, with corn, beans and coffee. The production is sold in the same area, the coffee is sold with moisture, dry or as a cherry. With the loan requested he will buy fertilizers for his field and to pay for cleaning it for the purpose of having a better harvest. His dream for the future is to expand his seeded field to have more income and help his family with their needs and build a house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and clean his coffee plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Munavarjon

texts.ru: Мунаварчон успешная женщина. Она любить заниматься всем видом работы и не боится трудностей. Женщины жители города Худжанд очень сильные, умные, заботливые и трудолюбивые. Они не смотря ни на, что трудятся и думают только идти вперед. Мунаварчон 35 лет. У нее двое детей. Детям 7 и 4 лет. Она занимается производством кровать более 10 лет. Ей на работе помогает ее муж. Мунаварчон решила приобрести новый станок для производство кровать, и расширить свою деятельностью. Мунаварчон надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Munavarjon is a successful woman.  She loves working all kinds of jobs and isn't afraid of difficulties.  The women of Khujand are very strong, smart, caring and hardworking.  They work very hard, no matter what their circumstances are, and think only of improving themselves.  

Munavarjon is 35 and has two children.  Her children are 7 and 4 years old.  She's made beds for a living for more than 10 years, and is helped by her husband.  Munavarjon has decided to buy a new machine tool to use for making beds and to expand her business.  Munavarjon is counting on your support.

loans.use: buy a new machine tool for making beds and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, maize and bean seedlings for planting

loans.name: Zarrinajon

texts.en:
Zarrinajon is a cheerful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1993. She is living in small town with her family. She is married and ready to become a mother. She is a student at University. 

She is fourth year student and studies at full time department. Her faculty is Finance and Accounting. She is a bright and active student. She is well known among students and friends. She is asking financial support to pay her higher education costs. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs in Finance and Accounting

loans.name: Acero Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres (María Alinda, Jahaira y Indira Julieta), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Acero, porque les permitirá ser mujeres poderosas y emprendedoras a través del financiamiento
 
Indira Julieta: Es una joven de 23 años de edad, cordial y alegre, integrante del Grupo Solidario ACERO, madre soltera de un pequeño de año y medio. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo, desde hace 7 meses se dedica a la venta de bastimentos y verdura en el corredor de su vivienda. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para diversificar sus productos, elaborar fritos y nacatamales, así poder ofertar más productos e incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 women (María Alinda, Jahaira y Indira Julieta).  They live in the city of Bilwi.  They joined together recently with the aim of working in solidarity in order to access loans through Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, improve their income, and therefore improve the quality of life of their families.  They decided to call their solidarity group Acero [Steel], because it will allow them to be powerful and enterprising women through financing.  

Indira Julieta is a friendly and cheerful young woman of 23 years.  She is a member of the solidarity group Acero.  She is a single mother of a 1-1/2 year old boy.  With the aim of providing for her son, she has made a living selling Nicaraguan staple foods and vegetables in the outdoor walkway of her home.  She is requesting her first loan to diversify her products, to make fried foods and Nicaraguan tamales, so that she can offer more products and increase her income.  Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: to diversify her products, make fried foods and Nicaraguan tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his house

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, is aged 51, married to a farmer and they're blessed with three children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. Her net income on her business was used or spent on their business expansion. 

Due to insufficient capital to use in her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, rice, and grocery items to sell in her store. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, rice, and grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 32 years old, married and blessed with four children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops to sell. He will be using the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm and he hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier for use in his service for more income gain

loans.name: Ngelese

texts.en:
Ngelese is a 65 married man with 8 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In addition to his cocoa farming which he has practiced for five years to provide basic necessities for the family.  He also gets additional income as a pensioner being a retired civil servant. 

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital are the main hardships he is facing however his personal goals is to educate his children. His business goals is to expand cocoa growing to supply the exiting market. Ngelese intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Saul Alexander

texts.es:
Saul tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a la venta de producto agrícolas, agroquímicos y fertilizantes, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en este rubro, su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de productos de su negocio, lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio, con esto el espera diversificar su mercadería y de esta forma poder atender los diversos requerimientos de los clientes de la zona lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul, 39, is in a common-law relationship, and has three children.  He lives with his family in the Nueva Arica district, in a rural area in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast.  The people of this district are primarily engaged in farming and ranching.

Saul is engaged in selling agricultural products such as agrochemicals and fertilizer.  He has over five years in this trade, and his business is located in a strategic location.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a large quantity of merchandise to stock his business, which will have a great impact on his business.  He hopes to diversify his merchandise and, in this way, be able to accommodate the diverse needs of the customers in the area.  Consequently, this will allow him to increase his income level and, therefore, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is 76 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of 3 children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which her son is unable to generate any amount of income. Her son wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Imtiaz has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Imtiaz is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her son's rickshaw so it can be back on the road

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He ventures on hog rasing business. Recently, Jerry availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins. Jerry deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grocery items, rice, soft drinks and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la crianza de animales y al comercio principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas, entre otros animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
54-year-old Ines, who lives with her partner, lives in her own home in a rural area in the district of Oyotún, which is in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. Most of the region's inhabitants have trades or raise livestock.
Ines has been raising and selling farm animals for 10 years and she runs her business from her home. She is applying for the loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, hens etc. to increase her business' stock. As well as doing this, she aims to meet her clients' needs, which will enable her to boost her income and, thereby, improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, hens etc. to increase her business' stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through application of modern farming technology to earn more income so as to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm and she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 49 years old and single.

Amalia works hard to provide for herself. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Amalia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Amalia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store so as to save money

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 56 years old from Lagodekhi district, Kakheti region. He lives with his pensioner mother, wife and 2 school-aged children. Irakli is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and produces wine to sell locally at a good price. Besides, he grows some fruits and vegetables on family-owned land. 

Irakli wants to start a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with the Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3800 GEL. With the received credit Irakli will purchase cement and will start trading. He will resell cement at higher price and will generate a stable income.

loans.use: to begin trading in cement and generate a stable income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh stocks of delightfully colored garments for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, concrete, bricks, sand and tiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and maize seeds for improved farming activity so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Sindangan, in the Philippines. She has been able to provide for her family doing this type of work. 

Estrella now wishes to plant a good variety of bananas on the coconut farm for additional yield. However, she is in need of working capital. Estrella presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for labor to hole and plant banana seedlings. Estrella has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for labor to hole and plant banana seedlings

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feed for high production so he may educate his children

loans.name: Khea

texts.en:
Khea is 37 years old and a mother of three children who are all in school, living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows rice on 1.30 hectares farmland, cassava on 3 hectares farmland and works on other farms for fee as the sources of her family’s income. 

She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years and she can earn about 58,700 KHR per day. Now she lacks funds to do the farming, so she decided to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and labor fees. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is an old client of the branch. She is married with six children with five attending school. Jesca is a primary teacher. She has been teaching for 21 years. However, she found out that her salary cannot meet all financial needs and she decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance, especially for school fee loans which enabled her to educate her children. Jesca applied for a loan of 3,800,000 UGX to buy agricultural inputs such as mulching materials and also to pay school fees for the children. Jesca thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled her to meet all her family financial needs, especially school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water for their family.

loans.name: Roselieta

texts.en: Roselieta operates a motor transport business and her husband is the driver. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 (Philippine pesos) in sales every day, from which she supports her family's needs. To continue her business, Roselieta availed herself of a loan to pay for the tires, inner tube, cowling, timing chain and repairs. She dreams to own motor units and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for the tires, inner tube, cowling, timing chain and repairs

loans.name: Luzma

texts.en: Luzma signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Luzma is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia has started her small-time small grocery business and became profitable, helping to support her husband in raising their family. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she has good salesmanship and characteristic effort.

 Recently she approached Paglaum for her much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a businessman in Oroquieta. He is 49 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Ricardo runs a retail store selling Venetian blinds made of bamboo that he made. These are commonly used in Filipino native houses. Running this type of business has supported his family, especially in the education of his children. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase more bamboo poles to be used for his business. Ricardo believes having enough inventory will allow him to cater to his customers' needs. He is thankful that he has signed up for membership with PMPC as his financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo poles to be used for his business.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en: Remegia is 65 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. Remegia vends snacks at a nearby school. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Remegia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is married and lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. She has five adult children. For the past thirty years, she has been a farmer. Luisa became a new member of PMPC because she wanted to be able to earn more through her business. She has decided to start raising hogs and is applying for a 13,000 PHP loan from PMPC to buy bags of pig feed and animal vitamins. She will be very happy someday if she can see her family living comfortably and bountifully.

loans.use: to buy bags of pig feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Willyn

texts.en:
Willyn is married and lives in Sindangan. Her husband earns a living through farming activities. 

At the age of 26, Willyn has never tired of pursuing her goals for the sake of the family. She is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. From her desire to earn additional income, she engaged in a sari-sari (small grocery) store business; PMPC stood by her to start her chosen business. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She wishes to increase her inventory and purchase bags of fertilizer for their farm. 

Willyn and her husband continue to seek business ideas on farming. This is proof that Willyn has the determination to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Oripa

texts.en: Oripa is 57 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for 12 years. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: In 2012, Genara learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Genara tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Genara borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Genara looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a 43 year old single mother with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and a build a strong house for them. She has been involved in selling fish for more than ten years. The  hardships she faces are price fluctuations and inflation, high government taxes and weather changes which affect her business greatly. 

However, Miria has a vision of expanding her business into new areas and educating her children from good schools. The purpose of the loan is to buy building materials like cement, bricks and sand for her residential house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, bricks and sand for her residential house.

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en: Zaira is 50 years old. She lives with her 2 children in Zugdidi district. Zaira works as a babysitter and gets a monthly salary. Her son works at a local car wash. Zaira wants to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,200 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and will begin a trading business. Zaira will be able to increase her income and thus improve the living conditions of her children. Ziara awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en: Lai is 26 years old and a mother of a small child, living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland and cassava on 2.5 hectares of farmland. She also works on another farm for a fee as an additional source of income for her family. She has been involved in these businesses for eight years and it provides her about 57,600 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now taking a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and  fertilizer and pay a plowing fee. She hopes to gain more yields than last year through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras, que se organizaron hace 1 año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. 
 
Maura Violeta: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre y amable, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 26 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: El mayor de 8 de años de edad estudia su cuarto grado de primaria y dos menores de edad.  Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como pescador y carpintero. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos, chiverías. Con el financiamiento anterior otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitieron construir un anexo de madera, para tener un local más amplio, para su negocio. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y comprar: pollo, carne molida, embutidos granos básicos, chivería, sopas instantáneas, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en: The group is made up of three determined women who setup the group a ear ago, with the aim of obtaining funding to help them improve their living conditions, cover their basic household expenses, provide an education for their children and expand their businesses. Maura Violeta: She is the solidarity group's coordinator. She is a cheerful and friendly woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 26 and is married with 3 children. The eldest is 8 and is in the fourth year at primary school and the two others are younger. Her husband works on a casual basis as a fisherman and joiner. With the aim of contributing to the household expenses, she set up a small grocery shop 2 years ago. In it, she sells basic goods and snacks. She used the previous loan (awarded by PANA PANA and funded by KIVA) to build a wooden annex so she could have bigger premises for her business. She is now seeking funding to diversify her goods and buy: minced meat, sausages, basic grains, snacks, instant soup, bread, and eggs, among other things. Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: diversify her goods and buy: minced meat, sausages, basic grains, snacks, instant soup, bread, and eggs, among other things.

loans.name: St. Noa Kiyinda School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sr. Theopista She is the Head teacher of St. Noa Primary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kiyinda in Mityana with 536 students. St. Noa School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Noa School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sr. Theopista ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 47-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Farhat's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a position to buy all of these products. Therefore, Farhat has applied for Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 61 year old woman and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children.  Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years.  Nasreen's daughter is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her father to manage the house hold. 
Nasreen daughter needs different kinds of goods for her tailoring business e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc , but due to insufficient financial means her daughter is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Nasreen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her daughter to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase needed supplies for her daughter's tailoring business

loans.name: Sengly's Group

texts.en: Sengly is a 36-year-old mother of three children, living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice on six hectares of farmland and being a paid worker have been the sources of her family’s income for eighteen years. This earns her about 72,200 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay a labor fee. She hopes to gain more yields than last year through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay a labor fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Irish May

texts.en:
Irish May is a minimum wage earner. She realized how difficult it is to survive, being totally dependent with her meager salary. She made sideline earnings selling dry goods and rice retail. She can easily bring her stocks to office and make good sales. 

Now, she wants to expand her business. She applied for a loan to purchase inventories in bulk to increase income. She doubled her efforts to support her sister, who requires more financial support for her education. In the future, she hopes to acquire a motor unit for easy transport of her stocks.

loans.use: to purchase bilk of goods

loans.name: Nazima

texts.en:
Nazima is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3 children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly and because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. 

Therefore Nazima has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nazima is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to repair his rickshaw

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: Bakungu est une commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Ukweli», âgée de 63 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants tous mariés. Elle est vendeuse des boissons sucrées sur la rue dans un quartier animé de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va s’approvisionner en 18 caisses de sucrées. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une maison et augmenter son capital. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Bakungu is a merchant and a member of the loan collective called “Ukweli”. She is 63 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children, all married. Bakungu has been a street vendor of soft drinks in a busy district in town since she was young. She is requesting a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima to grow her business. She is going to stock up with 18 cases of soft drinks. Thus, her wish is to purchase a parcel of land, build a house, and increase her capital. She thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to stock up with 18 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de cincuenta y cinco años de edad, que tiene gran amor por el trabajo, desde niño empezó a trabajar en agricultura y venta de granos básicos. Ahora gracias al apoyo de sus hijos, logro abrir en su casa de habitación una pulpería, donde oferta principalmente los productos que se cosechan en su finca. Lucha día a día para que su negocio siga creciendo.
Este esforzado hombre, ha recurrido a Kiva junto MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita construir un servicio higiénico, con todas las condiciones de salubridad, dado que en su casa todavía se tiene una letrina. Esto le ayudara principalmente a mejorar su salud y también a no contaminar el suelo.
texts.en: 55-year-old Luis is a man who really loves his work. He began working in farming and selling basic grains as a child. Now, thanks to the help of his children, he has managed to open a grocery shop in his house, where he offers mainly the products which he harvests on his farm. He works hard every day to keep expanding his business. A determined man, he has applied to KIva and MiCredito for a loan to build a toilet, which meets hygiene standards, as his home still has a latrine. This will mainly enable him to improve his health and will avoid contaminating the earth.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cuarentitres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras, de la etnia miskita (Marie, Maila y Delena). Se unieron hace 1 año, para acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria y tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus inventarios y mejorar sus ingresos. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario 43, en honor  a una finca de la coordinadora que se localiza en el kilometro 43 carretera a Puerto Cabezas-Managua.

MARIE: Es una mujer jovial, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 39 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos: 3 Mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la comercialización de carne de res y cerdo de manera ambulante. Su esposo le ayuda en su pequeño negocio. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar carne de mondongo, cerdo y carne de res y así incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en: This solidarity group is made up of 3 determined women of Miskito origin (Marie, Maila y Delena). They got together a year ago to obtain funding with a joint guarantee and to have the chance to increase their stock and boost their income. They chose the name Grupo Solidario 43, as a tribute to the coordinator's farm which is situated at kilometre 43 on the Puerto Cabezas-Managua road. MARIE: She is a cheerful woman and the coordinator of the Solidarity Group. A native of Puerto Cabezas, she is 39 and is married with 5 children. 3 of them are grown up and the other 2 are teenagers who go to secondary school. She has now been selling beef and pork in the street for 20 years and this allows her to have her own source of income. Her husband helps her with her small business. She is applying for funding to buy tripe, pork and beef so that she can boost her income. Her dream is to set up a grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy tripe, pork and beef

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel  es soltero, actualmente trabaja en una consultora   y por la noche estudia  gracias a su trabajo. Está estudiando la carrera de economía, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino y convertirse en un gran profesional.
Daniel está poniendo todo su esfuerzo para poder lograr su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por ser una profesional útil y digna.
texts.en: Daniel, who is single, currently works in a consultancy and, thanks to this job, is able to study at night. He is studying economics and intends to use his qualification to make it and become a successful professional. Daniel is giving his all in his ambition to be someone. He is seeking this loan to pay his fees, so he can continue his studies and keep striving to be a valuable and decent professional.

loans.use: to pay his university fees,

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Josie tried her luck on doing a business focusing on the sale of chicken cuts. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Josie has borrowed another loan to purchase stocks of chicken cuts. She wants to purchase stocks of chicken cuts for retail. 

Josie looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of chicken cuts for retail.

loans.name: Segundo Jaime

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la crianza de animales y comercio principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 02 años por lo que es conocido en su distrito y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a su moto ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto el espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 23 years old, single, and without any children to care for. He lives in the family home in the rural part of the Oyotún district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú. The inhabitants of the district mostly make a living through the raising of livestock and commerce. 

He earns a living by offering transportation services on his mototaxi. He's been in this line of work for two years which he is known for within the district and relies on good personal and work references from his customers. He requests loan to fix and maintain his motorcycle which is in bad shape. With the repairs he hopes to offer a better service to his customers which will allow him to increase his earnings and improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: Requests loan to fix and maintain his motorcycle which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Nubia Estela

texts.es:
Ella es Nubiela una mujer de 36 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, tres varones de 16, 6,4 y una mujer de 11 años, vive junto con su esposo quien es un trabajador que recibe el salario mínimo vigentes y su familia es algo amplia y el capital que gana su esposo en ocasiones se queda corto para pagar las cuentas principales, como los servicios públicos y la alimentación. 

Pensando en la situación cotidiana que se vive en su hogar decidió a principios de año montar un negocio que le permitirá no solo generar recursos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, si no que a su vez pudiera estar cerca de sus hijos.

Nubiela inicio con un negocio de venta de arepas, la arepa es el producto más consumido en el desayuno de los habitantes del municipio de Antioquia.

Su negocio ha sido tan bien acogido por los usuarios que le han preguntado cuando tendrá sillas, bebidas, para disfrutar de las arepas y como ella está iniciando no tiene el capital para realizar una inversión, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra 	de principalmente insumos (maíz), compra de refrescos, comprar mesa, silla, sombrilla.

Este préstamo el ayudara a tener un negocio bien montado y agradable para sus clientes que comparten una arepa y una buena conversación con La señora Nubiela.
texts.en: This is Nubiela, a 36-year-old mother of 4: 3 boys of 16, 6 and 4 years of age and a girl of 11. She lives with her husband who is a worker on the minumum wage. He has quite a large family and the money he earns is sometime not enough to pay the bills, such as utilities and food. With her family's day-to-day situation in mind, she decided earlier this year to set up a business to enable her not only to generate an income to improve her family's living conditions and to also be close to her children. Nubiela began by selling cornmeal cakes. Cornmeal is the most popular breakfast eaten by the inhabitants of the town of Antioquia. Her customers have been so pleased with her business that they have asked her when she will have some chairs and drinks so they can sit sown and enjoy their cornmeal cakes. As she is only just starting up her business, she does not have sufficient capital to make this investment and, therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy mainly supplies (corn) and soft drinks, a table, a chair and a parasol. The loan will help her to have well set up and pleasant premises where her customers can share a cornmeal cake and good conversation with her.

loans.use: to buy mainly supplies (corn) and soft drinks, a table, a chair and a parasol.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza, 51, is married with two children. She lives in Liloy, in the Philippines. She manages her meat shop with her husband as the butcher and has had this business for over 5 years. Eliza has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase 200 kilos of pig and cow. This will serve as additional inventory to display and sell to the local community. Eliza wishes to earn more from her business to continuously help her family.

loans.use: to pay for 200 kilos of pig and cow for additional inventory to display and sell to the local community.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta. She is 44 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra and sells charcoal. She buys whole coconuts for this business. 

Arlyn has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and loans. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to buy charcoal for resale. Arlyn hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to buy charcoal for resale.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Yeat's Group

texts.en: A 62-year-old father of four children and only one of them is in school, living in Kampong Thom province, Yeat is a rice farmer for more than five years and a paid worker is an additional income source of his family. These businesses could earn him about 41,700KHR per day. He has a purpose to build a private toilet for his family, but he has not enough funds to do so. Now he leads a group to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine. He hopes this loan will help his family to have a better health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for the health and welfare of the family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, a sus 63 años de edad, es una hombre soltero. Inicio un negocio de tienda de abarrotes por la gran necesidad de conseguir los recursos para su sostenimiento, esta actividad la aprendió solo.

Allí trabaja solo todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Su tenacidad, visión, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en el sector; sin embargo, ha sabido manejar la situación y ha aprovechado la ventaja de que el establecimiento ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el mercado.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar un congelador y surtido de bandejas de pollo al por mayor.

Manuel, con el sueño de ampliar su negocio, se visualiza en el momento que el establecimiento esté bien posicionado en el mercado y así poder acreditarlo para que crezca y perdure en el tiempo, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 63 years old and is single. He began his grocery store business because of the real need to obtain the means to support himself. He learned the business himself.

He works there alone everyday, managing to generate sufficient income to pay for his basic household needs. 

His tenacity, vision, perseverance and optimism have allowed him to overcome various obstacles which have presented themselves, especially with the large number of competitors in the sector. However, he has known how to manage the situation and has taken advantage of the fact that his establishment has a long history in the market.

He is currently requesting the support of a loan. He wants to use this to buy a freezer and wholesale chicken pieces.

With the dream of expanding his business, Manuel envisions his establishment being well positioned in the market, therefore becoming accredited so it can grow and last a long time, which will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and wholesale chicken pieces

loans.name: Sokkhea

texts.en:
Sokkhea is a 35-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is in school while the other two are too young to attend school. Sokkhea lives in Kampong Cham province. Her family’s living has depended on rice farming and a paid worker for 17 years. She could earn about 69,400 KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now taking a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income and have the ability to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 35-years-old married man from Dier city. he lives wife his wife and two sons in a small house. Alaa works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family living conditions but his income is barely covering all the family needs.
Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for his house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.
Alaa appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his house.

loans.name: Josepina Charito

texts.en: Josepina Charito busies herself with selling assorted products. She is able to support her husband providing for their daily needs and the education of their four children. Josepina Charito has a retailing business, she sells cosmetics, lingerie, clothing apparel and beauty and health products to the local community. She wants to expand her business to purchase more inventory to sell. She has reached out to Paglaum MPC for funding needs and applied for a loan of 13,000 PHP. She is happy to earn a good income each month. She hopes to open an outlet store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and beauty inventory to sell

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Romelia es una mujer de 48 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 25 años y 1 hija mujer de 28 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona norte de la ciudad, área caracterizada por pertenecer al caso viejo de la ciudad, antiguas construcciones algunas denominadas como patrimonio histórico. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/16 grados centígrados.
Romelia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por las actividades que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su hijo que es independiente, viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de lácteos, como leche, yogurt, soya, y otros. Actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado en su puesto de venta fijo, “en época de clases las ventas son constante en época de vacaciones escolares las ventas caen…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con temporadas de venta marcadas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para abastecer su negocio en temporada de ventas alta. Su sueño es ampliar el espacio de su kiosco ella desea realiza la compra de productos lácteos por mayor para abastecer la demanda de la época. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Romelia solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos lácteos por mayor para vender en temporada alta y con los beneficios ampliar el espacio de su kiosco.
texts.en:
Romelia is a 48-year-old single woman.  She has one son, age 25, and one daughter, age 28.  Her business is selling dairy products.

She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, independent, responsible, and very hard working.  She carries out her business in the northern zone of the city, an area that belongs to the city’s old town, which is characterized by old buildings, some of which are designated as historical heritage.  It has a cold, dry climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between -1° and 16° centigrade.

Romelia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears tied back, short stature, and a medium build.  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and due to the business she carries out.  She lives her life in the company of her son, who is independent.  They live in a rented room, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and a wood floor, and which has potable water, electric energy and a sewage system.  

Her business is selling dairy products, such as milk, yogurt, soy milk, and others.  She carries out this business from Monday to Saturday in her stationary sales stand.  “During the school year, sales are constant.  During school vacation periods, sales fall,” she comments.  The advantage of her business is that she has periods of strong sales.  The disadvantage is the lack of money to stock up her business during high sales periods.  Her dream is to expand her kiosk space.  She wants to buy dairy products at wholesale to stock up for the season’s demand.  This is her second loan cycle with the lending institution in the seven years she has been carrying out this business.

It is for these reasons that Romelia is requesting a loan to buy dairy products at wholesale to sell during the high-sales season, and with the profits she will expand her kiosk space.

loans.use: to buy dairy products at wholesale to sell during the high sales season, and with the profits she will expand her kiosk space.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann  is 60 years old residing at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and blessed  with two children one of whom is still an infant. She joined PMPC on 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she's accessing her 3rd loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to expand the area of her sari-sari store business in the local community.

loans.use: to expand the area of her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en: Melodia is from Liloy. She is earning a living in her small grocery store business, supporting her husband who provides income for their family. To generate more income, Melodia decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales. Melodia smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales

loans.name: Zakra

texts.en:
Zakra is 33 years old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three sons and two daughters. Her children are in school. . Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 5 years,. H husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold

 Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Zakra is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Zakra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits stock for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is from Sindangan, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. They have also cultivated rice on a small piece of land near their home. Lucena makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income.
