She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to finance farming activities and to buy fertilizer. She wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply more crops to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to finance farming activities and to buy fertilizer.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho, comenta que esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante, comenta que su anterior préstamo de kiva lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y con ello seguir con sus estudios.
Ella pide un nuevo préstamo para poder volver a pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Nathalia is studying for a law degree. She comments that she is making her greatest effort to be able to grow and move forward, and that she used her previous loan from Kiva to be able to pay her degree fees and continue with her studies. She is requesting a new loan to be able to pay her degree fees again and continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita has a coconut farm in Sibutad, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant variety of flowers. Carmelita makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for seedlings and fertilizers, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Carmelita wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products and flowers in the market.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her plants and flowers business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de una familia de Caaguazú está cursando el tercer año de contabilidad, y comenta que le gustaría poder tener su propio estudio contable.
Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante, y es por ello que está poniendo todo su mejor esfuerzo. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder estar detrás de su meta que es ser una profesional exitosa.
texts.en: Maria, whose family comes from Caaguazú, is in her third year studying accountancy. She says that she would like to have her own accountancy practice. She is a person who wants to get on in life and that is why she is giving her all. She is seeking his loan to pay her course fees and, thereby, be on course to achieve her goal, which is to be a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has three kids. For a living, she engages in laundry services and also ventures into buying and selling kitchen and plastic wares to the local community. Her business has been doing well for years now. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. Therefore, she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital for her existing business. She wants to pay for more inventory of kitchen and plastic wares for sale. 

Lolita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies. She wants nothing more than to live a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory of kitchen and plastic wares for sale.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en: Haide has a vegetable garden. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and also earning income for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to purchase a variety vegetable seedlings that she can grow and sell, as well as to pay for the land and seedbed preparation. In the future, Haide wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in her town and surrounding neighborhoods.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetable seedlings that she can grow and sell, as well as to pay for the land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is 30 years old,married and blessed with 3 children.She does farming and has been growing cash crops for sell. She will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is from Liloy. She and her husband have been farmers, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops. This is how they earn a living. Lucresia earns 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

As a new member of PMPC, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and to be able to engage in other agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 53 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 7 children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years. H husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. 

Suriya is also providing sewing services and to earn an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business, buy buying more needles, thread, cloth etc

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon, 46, is a married mother of three children with two of them attending school.  She is living in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia.  For 17 years her family’s main source of income has been from feeding pigs and selling them.  Selling grocery items and cassava farming are the additional sources of income. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now taking a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.  She hopes her cassava farming business will expand through this loan and she will gain additional yields as well.

loans.use: to buy more farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Inelda es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de hamburguesas.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger a los damnificados del desborde del río, situado a 12 kilómetros del área urbana central. Los migrantes que fueron llegando desde las provincias y el resto del país se asentaron en esta zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, Es uno de los distritos más pobres. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Inelda es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste blusa negra). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en el comercio, Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; tejido de mantas, producción de queso, venta de pescado, panadería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de fideo y venta de pollo, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades.  Su negocio es la venta de hamburguesas, ella recorre diferentes ferias y comercios empujando su carrito, con el que prepara y vende hamburguesas, “inicié mi negocio por la necesidad de independizarme, trabajo toda la semana y kiero abrir un local para dejar de ambular…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para ampliar el negocio. Su sueño es abrir un snack de venta de comida, Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes y de forma adecuada. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Inelda solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida a más clientes y abrir un snack de comida.
texts.en:
Inelda is a young 20 year old woman.  She lives with her partner, has no children, and she is in the hamburger sales business.  Inelda is enterprising, independent, persevering, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking.   She is developing her business in “Plan 3000”, an area settled by the survivors of the river flooding in 1983, and situated 12 kilometers from the city center.

Inelda is short and thin with a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long chestnut hair that she wears tied back.  Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish with the general population and for her business.  (She is seated in the center wearing a black blouse).  She shares her life with her partner, who works in trade.  They live in a rented room made of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, and a cement floor that has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.  

Inelda’s desire to succeed compelled her to lead a communal bank of people with businesses such as blanket weaving, cheese production, as well as fish, baked goods, secondhand clothing, noodle, and chicken sales to request loans and improve their businesses.  Her business is selling hamburgers, and she covers different markets and businesses pushing her cart.  “I started my business out of the need to become independent.  I work every day, and I wish to open a shop so that I can stop selling on foot” she says.  Her business’s advantage is that sales are steady, however, the disadvantage is that she doesn’t have investment capital to expand her business.  Her dream is to open a snack bar, and she wishes to expand her business by purchasing tables and chairs in order to comfortably serve more customers.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the three years that she has been engaged in this business.  For these reasons, Inelda is requesting a loan to purchase tables and chairs in order to sell food to more customers, and open a snack bar.
.

loans.use:
to purchase tables and chairs in order to sell food to more customers, and open a snack bar.
.

loans.name: Vikie

texts.en: Vikie, a diligent and hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to purchase additional items for her grocery store. This way, she will be able to sell more goods, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es:
Abelino vive en casa alquilada de material rústico, es soltero, vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio y está ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Abelino se dedica a la zapatería y también a la venta de carneros, chivos, etc. Cuenta con más de 45 años dedicandose a este rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de animales como carneros, chivos, etc. ya que Abelino desea invertir en este rubro porque cuenta con un amplio corral en donde los podrá criar de manera adecuada, para poder cubrir la demanda insatisfecha que existe en su zona además de satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de los pobladores. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Abelino lives in a rented house made of rustic material.  He is single, and lives in a rural area of the district that has water and electricity services.  Most people in his community work in agriculture, livestock raising, and commerce, and it is located in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Abelino works making shoes, as well as selling rams, young goats, etc.  He has been in this line of work for more than 45 years.  The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of animals, such as rams, young goats, and so on.  Abelino wants to invest in this work because he has a large corral where he can raise them appropriately.  This will allow him to fulfill the unsatisfied demand that exists in the area, as well as to satisfy the tastes and preferences of the residents.  There is no greater competition for this work in the zone, so he can get better prices, which will allow him to improve his income and, therefore, his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy animals, such as rams, young goats, etc.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.en: Estanislao is a pensioner. He is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. He is on his way to renovating his house. He wishes to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for the renovation of his house

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una persona humilde, cariñosa, trabajadora, aseada, que se dedica a la venta de alimentos como almuerzos, desayunos, los cuales realiza en la cocina de su hogar puesto que no cuenta con un local y genera un empleo a un mensajero encargado de repartir los pedidos.

Rosa vive junto con su pareja con la que tiene dos hermosa y morenas hijas de 9 y 2, se le ha presentado varios problemas en la zona siendo la inseguridad en su sitio de trabajo el principal motivo por el cual ella no progresa, los robos, las extorciones pero a pesar de estas problemáticas sigue en pie luchando por el futuro de su familia.

Rosa quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos típicos antioqueños y de la costa y adecuación de la cocina, ella admite que no es la más linda, pero si las aseada, quiere darle un mejor aspecto.
texts.en: Rosa is a modest, caring, hardworking and tidy woman whose work involves selling food such as lunches and breakfasts. She prepares the food in the kitchen of her home as she does not have any premises and she employs a messenger to deliver her orders. Rosa lives with her husband, with whom she has two beautiful, dark-haired daughters of 9 and 2. She has had a number of problems in her area, such as job insecurity, which is the main reason why she is not making progress, theft and extortion but, in spite of these problems, she keeps going and fights for her family's future. Rosa wants to apply for a loan to buy supplies for preparing typical dishes from the city of Antioquia and the coast and to adapt her kitchen. She admits that she is not the prettiest of women, but she is certainly neat and tidy and she wants to give herself a makeover.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing typical dishes from the city of Antioquia and the coast and to adapt her kitchen.

loans.name: Raeesa

texts.en:
Raeesa is a 42 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, the mother of 2 children.  Her husband has been running a general store for past four years. His only responsible is to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Raeesa's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Raeesa has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Raeesa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase stocks for her husband's general store business

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 43-year-old mother of six children and two of them are in school, living in Kampong Thom province; she is a rice farmer and a paid worker for twenty two years. She could earn about 52,800KHR per day. 

To fulfill her wish of building a small private toilet for her family’s uses, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a better health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for the health and welfare of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie has always had enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income, helping her husband in support of their family. At the age of 28 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family, most especially for her children's education. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for capital to support her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for the labor costs associated with land preparation for growing her crops. 

In the future, Genie wishes to own a motor cab for easy transport of her produce to any marketplace in the municipality.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs associated with land preparation for growing her crops.

loans.name: Yovana Domy

texts.es:
Yovana es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa Pacajes’; Los pobladores de este lugar se asentaron a partir del año 1970, la mayoría procedentes de los ayllus de ‘Jacha Suyu Pacajes’ por lo que decidieron en fundar y urbanizar con el nombre de Villa Pacajes. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -4/8 grados centígrados.
Yovana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja  estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (pollera, manta y sombrero) que sólo utiliza en las fiestas patronales, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista asalariado, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; hamburguesas, salchipapas (papas fritas con salchichas), sándwich de huevo y pollo frito. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en su puesto de venta fijo hecho de metal, “anteriormente trabajé en un restaurante de comida rápida, me independicé y ahora administro mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja, la desventaja es contar con una mejor ubicación. Su sueño es abrir un snack de pollo a la broaster, Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor número de clientes. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yovana solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Yovana is 26 years old and lives with her husband.  They have no children and she sells fast food.

She is an independent, stable, patient, friendly, responsible, and very hardworking entrepreneur.  She works on ‘Villa Pacajes.’  The people settled here in 1970, most came from Jacha Suyu Pacajes and decided to found and develop Villa Pacajes. The climate is cool and dry with a temperature that varies between -4 and 8 degrees Celcius.

Yovana is of olive complexion, dark eyes, long black hair that she ties back, of short stature, and thin.  She dresses in the traditional way (skirt, wrap around, and hat) that she only wears during festivals. Aymara is her native language which she speaks at home and Spanish in the general culture and business.  She’s married and works as a salaried transporter.  She lives in a family home and made of brick and cement with a metal roof and wooden floor.  It has running water, electricity, gas, and sewage.  She sells fast food such as hamburgers, salchipapas (fried potatoes and sausages), egg sandwiches, and fried chicken.

She works every day of the week at her metal stand.  “I used to work at a fast food restaurant and went out on my own.  Now I have my own business,” she says.  She has the advantage that she gets help from her husband and the disadvantage is that she needs a better location.  Her dream is to open a broasted chicken restaurant.  She wants to expand her business and buy tables and chairs so she can serve more customers.  This will be her first loan through the institution in the three years she’s had this business.

This is the reason Yolanda is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs so she can serve more customers and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Emma tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Emma loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Emma looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase compost and seedlings

loans.name: Brenda Enarge

texts.es: Brenda, tiene 26 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Brenda es una persona emprendedora, tiene cultivo de café el que vende en pergamino húmedo, y seco, además en su casa vende productos de la canasta básica como churros, arroz, frijoles, maíz, pan, sal y otros. Está solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café, va comprar abonos, fertilizantes y para limpieza. Este préstamo considera que le ayudará a mejorar y hacer crecer su cultivo. Su meta es cultivar mas fincas de café para mejorar el nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Brenda, age 26, is married and has two children.  She lives in a town that belongs to Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Brenda is an enterprising person.  She has coffee crops, which she sells in wet parchment and dry parchment.  In her house, she also sells staple household goods such as churros, rice, beans, corn, bread, salt, and others.  She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to maintain her coffee farm.  She is going to buy compost and fertilizer, and pay for cleaning.  She believes this loan will help her improve her crops and make them grow.  Her goal is to cultivate more coffee farms to improve her quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer and to pay for cleaning, to improve her coffee farm.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en casa propia en el Distrito de San felipe, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio donde vende arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, gaseosas, entre otros productos, cuenta con más de 06 años de experiencia en el rubro y muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto ella tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y obtener mejores utilidades lo que mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and in a common law marriage.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in her home in the San Felipe district, Jaen province, and Cjamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.  The people in this area mainly farm and raise animals.

She is a merchant and has a store in her home where she sells rice, sugar, milk, noodles, carbonated drinks, and other things.  She’s been doing this for more than six years and comes with very good personal and professional references.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise in quantity and better stock her store so she can increase her sales and improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Yhon Jairo

texts.es:
Yhon es un hombre de 51 años de edad que todos los días sale a vender aguacates y legumbres en una carreta que empuja manualmente, es un hombre soltero que vela únicamente por su sostenimiento y apoya a sus padres, trabaja 8 horas diarias e inicio su actividad empíricamente una tarde del año 2005m cuando se cansó de buscar empleo y fundo su propio negocio.

Yhon trabaja comúnmente cerca al parque principal, aunque recorre los barrios cuando las ventas están difíciles, vive del día a día.

Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, posiblemente contratar una persona para que cubra otro sector, Yhon quiere solicitar un apoyo económico el cual desea invertir en la compra de aguacates, y legumbres. Este préstamo le ayudara de abastecer un buen surtido, comprándolo en cantidades el cual le sale muy económico y podrá generar mayor utilidad por cada venta que realice.
texts.en:
Yhon, 51, has a hand-drawn cart for carrying the avocados and lettuce that he sets out to sell every day.  He is a single man and earns enough from the business to support himself and help his parents too.  He works 8 hours a day.  He remembers the exact day in 2005 that he started the business because he was fed up looking for work and decided the only way forward was to work for himself.  

Yhon generally operates his business near the city's main park, but he moves to other parts of the city when sales are slow there.  Even so, he lives from day to day.

Yhon is applying for a loan that he will use to grow his business.  He wants to increase his sales and maybe even hire an employee to sell for him in another part of the city.  For now, he will buy avocados and lettuce to stock his business with the produce he sells.  The investment will allow him to buy larger quantities of produce which, in turn, will reduce his costs and bring him a better return.

loans.use: to stock his fruits & vegetables business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 76 years old and a widow. She lives in Ozamiz City. For the past one years, Rosario has been a hog raiser. Rosario is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to build a concrete pig pens and purchase sacks of feeds. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: build concrete pig pens and feed for her hogs

loans.name: Asenal Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who is still at school. She has been running two projects, selling cosmetics and fabrics, for eight years now. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Zainabu's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her cosmetics stock and start selling fabrics. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their loan. She used the profits to pay school fees, repay her loans, buy a plot of land and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up to date cosmetics and also to increase on the stock to meet her customers' demands and requests. She dreams of building her own house.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group Asenal, which consist of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date cosmetics and also to increase on the usual stock to meet her customers' demands and requests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds so as to increase the livestock produce for sale in the market and meet family needs.

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer emprendedora, orgullosa, amorosa, una persona que quiere salir adelante, perseverante preocupada pro su familia, ella es empresaria peor a la vez madre de dos hijas de 11 y 9, tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos con los que genera los ingresos restantes para pagar las cuentas en su hogar, sabiendo que el otro capital lo aporta su pareja.

Mónica tiene sueños quiere pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, tener sostenibilidad, progresar, convertir su venta de alimento en una tienda de abarrotes, proyectos que quiere cumplir no solo pro el bienestar de su familia, por superación personal.

Mónica quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos como galletas, chocolates, frituras, dulces, caramelos, chupetas, gomas de mascar etc.
texts.en:
Monica is an enterprising, proud, and loving person. She wishes to succeed, and she perseveres because she is concerned about her family.  She is a business woman but, at the same time, she is a mother of two children, ages 11 and 9.  She has a business selling food with which she generates the income to pay the household expenses, knowing that her husband contributes the remaining funds.
  
Monica’s dreams are to pay for her children’s education, improve her living conditions, have sustainability, progress, and convert her food sales business into a grocery store, projects that she wishes to complete not only for the benefit of her family, but for personal success.  Monica wishes to request a loan to purchase products such as cookies, chocolates, fried food, candy, carmels, lollipops, chewing gum, etc.

loans.use: to request a loan to purchase products such as cookies, chocolates, fried food, candy, carmels, lollipops, chewing gum, etc.

loans.name: Gabriel Antonio

texts.es:
Gabriel es un hombre de 32 años padre de dos hijos uno de 4 y otro de 1, vende productos de la canasta familiar en un negocio que constituyo en el año 2010 donde trabaja junto con su esposa tratando e copar el mayor horario para aumentar las ventas,
Su sueño es pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello debe mejorar las ventas y podría lograr aumentando y diversificando su inventario por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar insumos de productos de aseo personaL, aseo para el hogar, pañales, y leche para recién nacidos ya que hay muchos bebes en la zona.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a 32 year old man with two sons aged four and one.

 He sells essential products in a business he started in 2010 and where he works alongside his wife, they try to be open for the best hours possible to increase their sales. 

Gabriel's dream is to pay for his children's education and improve their living conditions. Thus he needs to improve sales in the store and to do so he must increase and diversify the products he has for sale. This is the reason Gabriel is seeking a loan, to buy personal hygiene  products, cleaning products, diapers and milk for newly-borns, as there are now many new babies in the region.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene  products, cleaning products and diapers.

loans.name: Lilia Ana

texts.es:
Ella es Lina es una mujer adulta muy trabajadora, emprendedora, capaz, sobresaliente que se dedica a la confección a terceros, una profesión que con mucho cariño y compromiso adquirió ya que en su hogar necesitaban ingresos extras para poder mantenerse, ella es madre de dos hijas de 10 y 5 su deseo es verlas estudiando y crecer en un hogar firme, que no les falte nada por ello desde muy temprano labora, para poder llevar ese pan a la mesa.

Lina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de unos insumos para fabricar unas prendas que tiene como pedido, el apoyo será muy importante porque será el inicio de su línea propia de confección. 

Con el préstamo comprara telas y herrajes que los usara para fabricar Blusas y pijamas para sus clientes.
texts.en: Lina is a very hardworking, enterprising, capable, excellent woman whose work involves making clothes for people. She undertook the job with great care and commitment as her family needs additional income to support itself. She is the mother of two daughters, aged 10 and 5, and her ambition is want to see them get a good  education and grown up in a secure home and that they should want for nothing. Therefore, she starts work very early to be able to put bread on the table. Lina wants to apply for a loan to buy some supplies to make clothing for which she has orders. This support will be very important because it will enable her to set up her own clothing label. She will use the loan to buy fabric and metal fasteners for making blouses and pyjamas for her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and metal fasteners which she will use to make blouses and pyjamas for her customers.

loans.name: Camela

texts.en:
Camela is married and currently lives with her husband and four children in Canubay, Oroquieta. She is very responsible and hardworking with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. For a living, Camela and her husband are both farmers who plant rice, corn, root crops and beans. 

Camela wants to live in a decent house. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and sticks, for her house. In the future, she deeply hopes to see all her children with stable financial status.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and sticks, for her house

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is known in his neighborhood area as being a hard-working father. He is engaged in farming activities as his primary source of income to provide for his family. He became a member of PMPC, and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair his house for a safe and comfortable living. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority, as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair his house for a safe and comfortable living

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer soltera de 67 años que mantiene viajando a pueblos vendiendo sus mercancías, gracias a estas ganancias ella puede pagar sus cuentas, puesto que solo se vale de ella misma dado que no tiene ni pareja ni hijos que la apoyen, en el momento está próxima a realizar un viaje y desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía para vender, estos viajes son muy productivos y le generan buenos ingresos y clientes.

Por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar ropa para hombre y mujeres este préstamo le permitirá comprar un buen surtido de mercancía que de seguro le dará una buena rentabilidad para el sostenimiento de ella misma.
texts.en:
Luz is a single 67 year old woman who makes a living travelling to different towns and selling her merchandise. 

Thanks to her earnings, Luz is able to pay her bills, she has only herself to rely upon as she does not have a partner or children to support her. 

Soon Luz will set off on another sales trip and is seeking a loan to buy merchandise to sell, these trips are very lucrative and generate good earnings and customers. Luz will use the loan to buy men's and women's clothing and this loan will allow her to buy a good range of merchandise that will create decent profits so that she can continue to sustain herself.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise to sell, these trips are very lucrative and generate good earnings and customers.

loans.name: Sara Mildrey

texts.es:
Sara hace un año empezó un camino que espera que la lleve al éxito y la felicidad, es una joven de tan solo 18 años de edad que comenzó un negocio de confección a terceros.

Sara tuvo que abandonar sus estudios, buscar trabajo porque hace tres años en un momento de locura quedo embarazada y hoy es una madre cabeza de familia que cuenta con una empleada en su negocio y buenas miras de crecimiento. 

Su meta su sueño es crecer, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que a su hija no le falta nada y cuando este un poco más grande retomar su estudio, por lo pronto presenta una necesidad, requiere comprar una maquina fileteadora para optimizar y aumentar su producción, como no tiene capital quiere recurrir a un crédito para comprar esta maquinaria.
texts.en:
A year ago Sara started on a path that she hopes will lead her to success and happiness. She is a young woman, only 18 years old, who started a dressmaking business for third parties.

Sara had to abandon her studies and find work because three years ago in a moment of madness she became pregnant. Today she is the head of the family with one employee at her business and good intentions to expand.

Her aim is to grow and improve the condition of her house so that her daughter is not in need of anything. When her house is a little bigger she wants to resume her studies, which for the time being is a necessity. She needs to buy a sewing machine to optimise her production. As she does not have capital she wants to take out a loan to buy the machinery.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to optimise and increase her production.

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es:
Ella es Ana, una mujer de las zonas rurales que se dedica como buena campesina a la cría de animales, en su negocio se ve andar y caminar cerdos, estos animales son la actividad principal de la familia de Ana y que ya tiene tradición debido a que ha sido trasmitido los conocimientos de generación en generación.

Ana es madre de 35 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, la mayor de 19 y los varones de 12 y unos gemelos de 8 años de edad, ellos depende enteramente de sus padres. El principal sueño de Ana es verlos estudiando, crecer felices, sanos, alejados de vicios y con deseos de entrar a la universidad.

Ana quiere mejorar sus ventas, optimizar su negocio, tener sostenibilidad en el tiempo y para ello debe competir con los demás criadores de cerdos y aguantar el alza de precios de productos agrícolas que hay en este momento.

Para todo ello tiene a su amigo Interactuar quien junto con su aliado Kiva, quiere prestarle la mano para que ella pueda comprar materiales para modificar sus cocheras creándoles canales de riegos, canales de desecho fecales, pozo de alimento, compra de cerdos y alimento.
texts.en:
Ana, 35, lives in a rural part of Colombia and, like many local people, makes her living raising and selling farm animals.  Specifically, she raises and sells pigs.  It's a family business, the skills of which have been passed down from parents to children over generations.

Ana has 4 children: a 19-year old daughter; a 12-year old boy; and 8-year old twins, both boys.  Her greatest hope is to see her children healthy and happy, free of bad habits and college-bound.  

Ana wants to grow her business and ensure that she can compete with other suppliers and pull her business through the difficulties related to the recent increases in farm input costs.  

Ana is applying to Interactuar, a Kiva partner, for a loan, part of which she will use to dig two trenches, one for water and another for fecal waste, and construct new feeding troughs.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pigs and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy more animals and make improvements to her pig pen.

loans.name: Elicia..

texts.en:
Elicia, who in in her late twenties, is single with no kids.  She has been running a shop and also sells cold drinks for one years now.  She works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Elicia's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to raise and sell broiler chicken, had a food cafe, opened a shop, started selling soft drinks and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her business and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profit to take care of herself, bought a plot of land, loan repayment and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the shop inventory and to buy drinks in order to meet her customers' request. She dreams of building her own house.

Elicia will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory and to buy drinks in order to meet her customers' request.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Alicia Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Alicia es una madre de 39 años de edad, humilde, trabajadora, amorosa, muy recta y estricta con sus hijos, tiene 4 muchachos adolescentes y es muy firme en su crianza para alejarlos de los malos vicios, ella no solo es un ama de casa, es una empresaria reconocida en el sector por su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, una salida muy útil para sus vecinos que no pueden obtener estos artilugios por cuestiones económicas. 

Fundo este negocio con la clara intención de mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, crió a sus hijos, ahora ellos están buscando trabajo para pagar sus estudios y ella junto a su esposo mantendrán el hogar y su proyecto a largo plazo es construir una vivienda en material (concreto).


Alicia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de repuestos de lavadora, ya que por el viaje y el trato de diferentes clientes, tiende a dañarse muy rápido, también quiere comprar una lavadora para tener mayor cobertura. 

Tú apoyo ayudara a que esta empresaria siga mejorando su cobertura y calidad de servicio.
texts.en:
Alicia, 39, is a modest, hard-working woman.  She is a loving mother to her 4 sons, but strict and demanding, as well, careful to keep them away from trouble.  

Alicia is not only a stay-at-home mom, she's an entrepreneur too.  She rents washing machines, a very useful service here because not all of her neighbors can afford washing machines of their own.  She started the business with the clear idea that she could both earn a living and care for her sons at the same time.  The boys are now old enough to earn money for school and are looking for work.  Alicia and her husband pay other family expenses and are saving for a sturdier-built house.

Alicia is applying for a loan that she will use to buy spare parts for the washing machines that she rents.  The machines become damaged over time as they are moved around and not all of her customers are as careful with them as others.  She also wants to buy another washing machine.

Your help will allow this enterprising woman to carry on and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy parts for her washing machine rental business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and cast iron for manufacturing spare parts of vehicles by her husband.

loans.name: Lilia Rosa

texts.es:
Lilia es una mujer viuda de 52 años de edad que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para mejorar su negocio de confección.
Lilia se encuentra solicitando el préstamo debido a la necesidad que tiene de tener la materia prima que es la tela de trabajo para confeccionar prendas que son su sustento, ella paro por un tiempo debido a la impotencia, la tristeza que genero en ese momento la perdida de su marido pero no puede lamentarse y quiere seguir adelante para mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda, para contratar personas, para ampliar su taller, tiene muchos proyectos y metas que se trazo cuando inicio el negocio y por lo pronto quiere cumplirlos.
Lilia solicita un préstamo con el que quiere lograr dos objetivos, uno es la adecuación de su negocio, reorganización y aprovechamiento de su espacio de trabajo y pro último es la compra de telas.
texts.en:
Lilia is a widowed woman, 52 years old, who is requesting a loan to improve her sewing business. She is requesting this loan due to the need for raw materials, the working fabric for sewing articles of clothing, which is her livelihood.

Lilia stopped working temporarily due to the helplessness and sadness created by the loss of her husband, but she can’t feel sorry for herself. She wants to keep moving forward to improve her living conditions, hire people and expand her workshop. She has many projects and goals that she planned out when she started the business and for now, she wants to achieve them.

Lilia is requesting a loan with which she wants to attain two objectives: the first is store renovation, reorganization and optimization of her workspace, and the last is the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: renovate her store and buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 44-year-old married father of three children. He started four years ago working as a plumber to cover his family's increasing needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation among his customers for his professional skills. 

Haitham's family is his priority, he is trying desperately to improve their living conditions. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees.
Haitham hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his 3 children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 19-year-old married woman from Gori. She has a husband, who works at the security services and gets 200-300 GEL monthly. Diana is a saleslady at the local store and generates her own income that is hardly enough for the family to satisfy financial stability. In order to increase the productivity and make her own business, Diana decided to start trading with fruits and vegetables. 

She requested a loan to local financial institutions and was approved within the start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The program gives a chance to poor people to make their own businesses. Diana plans to purchase a stock of products and have money for working capital. She will make a counter in the store where she works nowadays. She will continue doing her own work as a sales lady and also will get the chance to get the whole profit from selling fruits and vegetables. 

Diana is a hard-working and motivated woman, who has a great desire to make better living conditions for her family and also to make her work more productive. She awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness to maintain the business.

loans.use: To start her own business and trade with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 45 years old, married and a mother of two, joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from its training, especially that offered in enterprise development and financial management.

Monica practices dairy and sheep farming and grows cabbages, potatoes and coriander. She will use this Kiva loan to buy a calf to meet her customers'  demand for more milk and to increase her income. 

Very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their financial support, Monica promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy a calf to increase milk production

loans.name: Mukeu Unity Women Group

texts.en:
The lady holding a passbook is Naomi; 46 years old married and a mother of four children. 
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development. 

She is a mixed farmer growing potatoes, cabbages, carrots, and also keeps a dairy cow. She also sells second hand clothes to supplement her income.  She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more clothes to add stock to her second hand clothes selling business for increased sales and income. This will enable her pay for quality education for her children.

She is happy and thankful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add stock to her second hand clothes selling business for increased sales and income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, estudia en la ciudad de Carapeguá, comenta que quiere salir adelante, y es por ello que se está esforzando mucho por cumplir su meta.
Él quiere ser un profesional independiente que a través de sus estudios se haga conocido para poder ayudar también a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de manutención, y también para el pago de sus útiles de universidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Jose is studying Business Administration in the city of Carapegua.  He wants to get ahead in the world, he says, and is working hard to meet his goal.  
Jose hopes his studies will lead to a long career and says that he would like to be known for helping others.
Jose is applying for a loan that he will use to pay his college fees and related expenses.  He is grateful, he says, for your support.

loans.use: to pay college fees and related expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for university fees.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Loicy

texts.en: Loicy is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a marketable area and her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
Bernardino tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene cinco hijos, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 8 años por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia y con clientes fijos que dan buenas referencias de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera brindar un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bernandino is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children. He lives with his partner and children in the District of Lagunas, a community that is dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Bernandino grows coffee and has been in this business for eight years. He has a great amount of experience and his established customers have provided good references on his behalf. His loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his coffee crop. Bernardino hopes to provide a better product to his customers so that his earnings will increase. This would eventually lead to a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ume  Kalsoom

texts.en:
Ume Kalsoom is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz una mujer creativa que adora la fotografía, desde pequeña siempre mostro gran pasión por esta profesión, la liberta, libre expresión que se mostraba la atrajo mucho tanto así que a sus 46 años la fotografía se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos, gracias a loq eu produce puede comer, puede actualizarse en cursos y quiere seguir adelante y no dejarse vencer pro la competencia y la falta de recursos para estar a la altura de ellos.

La fotografía es un tema de actualización, las mejores empresas siemrpe están a la vanguardia y pequeñas pymes como ella trabajan con lo poco que peuden conseguir, en la foto se ve ella junto a su equipo de fotografía.

Beatriz está ansiosa muy expectante por un posible crédito que le ayudara a actualizarse y comprar equipo de trabajo con el que podrá aceptar cualquier trabajo y garantizarlo.

Beatriz se encuentra solicitando un aliento económico para comprar los siguientes productos:

•	2 trípodes
•	Luces 
•	Flash 
•	Programa de computador para diseñar y editar fotos 
•	Sombrillas de fotografía 
•	Lente 182000
texts.en:
Beatriz, 46, has a flair for photography and has managed to build a business around it.  Photography has been a passion for her since she was a girl and the freedom of expression that it represents still attracts her all these years later.  Even better, she can work at what she loves and still put food on the table!  She hopes to continue studying her art, no matter the obstacles that she faces from larger competitors and a relative lack of resources.

Larger suppliers of photography services can provide cutting-edge services that small businesses like Beatriz's can't easily match.  Even so, she carries on and you can see her in the photo with some of the equipment that she uses for her business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy equipment that will allow her to take on a wider range of work and ensure that she can deliver a good product to her customers. 

Beatriz will use the loan to buy:
- 2 tripods
- Lights
- Flash
- Software for designing & editing photos
- A parasol for controlling light
- An 182000 lens

loans.use: to buy equipment for her photography business.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 26 years old woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is 46 years old and from Zugdidi district. She lives with her pensioner mother, son and daughter-in-law. Zhana trades in fruits and vegetables and generates a small monthly income.

Zhana wants to open a bakery and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,100 USD. With the received credit, Zhana will purchase a stock of flour, sugar, and so on to bake cakes in her newly opened bakery. She is very experienced in this field and hopes that she will have a good number of satisfied clients.

Zhana awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery and bake cakes.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is 55 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 4 children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Zuhran

texts.en:
Zuhran is a 55-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sales and purchasing for many years. Zuhran fully supports and assists her husband with his work. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 45-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has owned a barber shop for the past 20 years. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. 

Robins's husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for his barber shop, but due to financial constraints her husband is not capable to buy these items for the business purposes. Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items for the business purpose so that her husband can provide better services to his customers. It will also be helpful for her husband to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Robina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics to increase her husband's barber business

loans.name: Farooq

texts.en:
Farooq is a 47-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Farooq ’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Farooq  has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new auto bodies along with some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Farooq is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new auto bodies along with some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida  is a married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband, who is also shown in the photo, is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is a dedicated person who owns a small school. He wishes to provide education to every child in his community irrespective of their family income. That was the main purpose of establishing his school some years ago.

Rafiq needs to purchase furniture along with stationery items for his school, so he has requested a loan worth 100,000 PKR. He plans to increase school enrollment in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture along with stationery items for his school.

loans.name: Bahati Weavers Co-Operative Society Limited Group

texts.en:
Bahati weavers Co-operative Society Limited is a group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014.The group has benefited much from hand in hand Eastern Africa training mostly on savings and enterprise development. They are able to mobilize available resources to support their families  and  they have knowledge on managing their small enterprises. Most of the members do basketry and agricultural activities.

The person raising her hand is Anastacia, 63 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more weaving materials such as weaving threads and sisal fibre for her basketry business. This will improve her business thus more income and be able to provide for her family as well as pay school fees for her children.
Anastacia thanks Kiva and their lenders for supporting her enterprise and promises to pay back well.

loans.use: To buy sisal fibre and weaving thread that will boost basketry business thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Maria Amilbia

texts.es:
María es una mujer que cuida sus raíces indígenas, ella es madre de 5 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa con la cual genera sus ingresos pues como el enseñaron en su tribu tiene que valerse por sí misma y más aún que le toco adaptarse al ritmo citadino. 

María inicio con el negocio con la única intención de adecuarse a las condiciones de vida en la ciudad, que su familia tuviera alimento, techo y estudio y hasta el día de hoy cumple.

María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abrigos, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, faldas y abrigos, preparándose para la temporada de día del padre y feria de flores.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who honors her indigenous roots. She is the mother of 5 children who are all adults. She works in clothing sales, with which she generates her income. As her tribe taught her, one has to value oneself, and even more so since she has had to adapt to the urban rhythm.

Maria started with the business with the sole intention of adapting to the conditions of city life, so that her family could have food, shelter, and education. To this day, she has fulfilled her intentions.

Maria wants to request a loan to purchase coats, pants, blouses, T-shirts, and skirts, preparing for the Father’s-Day and flower-festival season.

loans.use: to purchase coats, pants, blouses, T-shirts, and skirts in preparation for the Father's-Day and flower-festival season.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es un hombre de 63 años de edad que se dedica al trabajo independiente desde hace más de 20 años, el conduce un vehículo en el cual transporta personas, es un hombre casado, y tiene dos hijos que depende en la totalidad de él.

El negocio fue heredado de su padre, quien le enseño a conducir, con el pasar del tiempo este negocio también se ha transformado en el medio de sostenimiento de su familia y quiere que sea el de su hijo.

Luis Fernando tiene dos propósitos en su vida, darles educación a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, en el momento mantiene su hogar y está ahorrando para pagar la educación universitaria de su hija mayor.


Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo y pintarlo, quiere darle un mejor aspecto y brindar seguridad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is 63 years old and has been making a living working independently for more than 20 years, he drives a car in which he transports people. 

Luis is married with two children who depend on him completely. He inherited the business from his father, who also taught him how to drive. Over time the business became the source of income for the family and he wanted the same for his son. 

Luis Fernando has two goals in life: provide his children with an education and improve his family's living conditions. At this time, he looks after his home and is saving to pay for the university education of his eldest daughter. 

Luis is seeking a loan to to service and paint his car, in order to make it look better and offer better security to his customers.

loans.use: to service and paint his car, in order to make it look better and offer better security to his customers.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Maureen. She is 32 years old, married, and a mother of three children.

Maureen  joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011. She has benefited a lot from  training on savings and enterprise development where she was able to acquire skills on better saving methods, enterprise management, and managing her income from the enterprise prudently. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy seeds and pesticides for her enterprise which will enable her to earn more income thus provide her family's needs with ease.

Maureen is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the assistance and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides that will help boost farming thus generate more income.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Three years ago, Musarat set up her own school in a small space with a handful of students. Today there are 262 students in her school, the majority of whom are girls. She believes in the economic and social empowerment of women and that it starts from a school level where teachers play a vital role. 

Currently Musarat employs eight teachers who support Musarat’s belief. Hoping to purchase furniture such as chairs, desks and blackboards, Musarat  has requested a loan worth 100,000 PKR.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as chairs, desks, and blackboards.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Tabitha, thirty five years old, married and a mother of four children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited a lot from enterprise management training. The skills acquired has enabled her to run her business effectively. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feeds to boost her dairy farming business by increasing milk production, thus earn more income that will help meet the family's needs with ease.

Tabitha is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their assistance and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds that will boost dairy farming and increase milk production, thus earn more income that will help meet the family's needs with ease.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 37-year-old married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Shazia makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Shazia wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing a good quality life to her family members. One of her children is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con sus padres, está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, con el objetivo de prepararse como profesional. Comenta que aspira a tener un negocio propio que podrá manejar por medio de sus conocimientos.
Al mismo tiempo, que estudia también trabaja, lo cual es muy difícil y sacrificado.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Pilar and lives with her parents. She is studying for a degree in Business Administration in the hope of preparing herself for professional work. Maria says that she aspires to have her own business that she will be able to manage by means of her knowledge.
 
Alongside her studies, Maria also works which is difficult and demanding. She is requesting this loan in order to pay her university fees and with that to be able to continue studying as she has been. She is grateful for the opportunity that she has been given to be able to improve each day.

loans.use: to pay her University fees.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.ru: Улфат добрейший человек и с чистой душой. Она гостеприимная женщина и эталон домохозяйки и хранительницы очага. Ни один человек не уйдет из ее дома без настроения или печальным. Улфат также вкусно готовит. Кроме готовки она профессиональная швея. Ульфат шьет чехлы, одеяла и матрасы для национальных люлек. Также на чехлах она делает вышивки национальными орнаментами. Она работает очень качественно, и каждая ее работа становится бесценным шедевром. Достаточно увидит одно из ее работ, чтобы убедиться. Ульфат за свою работу требует не дорого, так как жители ее городка Худжанд зарабатывают мало и не могут позволить много роскоши. Ульфат хочет расширить деятельность купить ткань нитки, швейные принадлежности и шить больше товара и вывести на продажу, чтобы накопить деньги на свадьбу своих детей. У нее двое детей сын и дочка. Ульфат заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ulfat is a kind person with a pure heart. She is a hospitable woman and an excellent housekeeper and homemaker. Not a single person leaves her house in a bad mood. She also cooks very well and besides this is a professional seamstress. She sews covers, blankets and mattresses for traditional cradles. She also embroiders the covers in traditional designs. Her work is of the highest quality and everything she makes becomes a priceless masterpiece. You only have to see one of her pieces to be convinced. She doesn't ask a lot for her work, since the residents of her city of Khujand earn little and can't allow themselves many luxuries.

Ulfat wants to expand her business by buying fabric, thread and sewing implements so she can sew and sell more goods, in order to save toward her children's weddings. She has two children, a son and a daughter. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase sewing implements, fabrics and thread

loans.name: Ramón George

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Ramón, tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y  vive en casa de unos familiares. Lleva dos ciclos en el grupo de Crédito y le gusta la institución por la ayuda que les brindan a personas como él para poder sacar sus actividades comerciales adelante.
El señor Ramón es un hombre que le ha gustado trabajar para  salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares con los gastos de la casa, el tiene una tienda de víveres en el mercado de Tarqui, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, son muchos los clientes que tiene  en los más de 30 años que lleva con sus negocio el cual le deja muy buenas satisfacciones.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda.  Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que tiene que pagar arriendos
texts.en:
The loan group Sagrado Corazón (Sacred Heart) meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited at every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Ramón lives with his family in this city, is 42 years old and single.  He has been in this loan group for two cycles and he likes the institution for the help it provides people like him to be able to progress their businesses.

Ramón is a man who has enjoyed working to get ahead and help his family members with household expenses.  He has a grocery stall in the Tarqui market where he sells all kinds of products such as grains, detergents, meats, vegetables and other basic necessities. He works every day from 6am to 7pm.  With more than 30 years in this business, he has many clients which gives him great satisfaction.

This loan will be used to invest in foodstuffs to stock his store.  He has been with this credit group for two cycles and he likes that the loans are very quick.  His dream is to have his own store as he currently has to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are ladies. 

Pamela describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Susy Yamalie

texts.es:
Susy Yamalie tiene 25 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, etc. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de más animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Susy Yamalie is 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in a rural area of the Oyotún district in Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. The locals work mainly in farming, small businesses, and raising livestock.

Susy Yamalie raises and sells animals such as ducks, hens, roosters, chickens, pigs, etc. She has more than 5 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references from people in the area.

The loan will be used to purchase more animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, as well as balanced feed to fatten them. This investment will help Susy achieve greater animal variety and productivity, which will have a great impact on her business. She plans to increase her stock of animals in order to meet different tastes and needs of customers in the area, which will increase her income and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, as well as balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Dalinda Celeste

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dalinda, tiene 71  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido es jubilado.
Doña Dalinda es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos, carteras, sabanas, perfumes, sobrecamas, cortinas entre otros productos, ella viaja a otros países a comprar la mercadería y luego la vende ya sea al por mayor a otros comerciantes o al público en general, ella vende más barato y así asegura sus ventas, tiene más de 40  años que se dedica a este negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, sabanas, sobrecamas, entre otras cosas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando cada vez mas.
texts.en:
The loan group Sagrado Corazón (Sacred Heart) meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited at every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Dalinda lives in this city, is 71 years old and married with 5 children from this marriage who are now adult and independent.  Her husband is retired.

Dalinda is a woman who loves to work to pay the household bills.  She works selling clothes, shoes, handbags, sheets, perfumes, bedspreads and curtains amongst other products.
