She travels to other countries to buy merchandise and later sell it, either wholesale to other business owners or to the general public.  She sells at a cheap price and thus assures her sales.  She has worked in this business for rmore than 40 years.  

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, sheets and bedspreads amongst other products.  She has been in this loan group since it started and she likes it as the loans can be obtained rapidly.  Her dream is to always continue improving.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, sheets, bedspreads etc.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия, 54 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Она решила заняться разведением скота еще 35 лет назад. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке на сегодняшний день Зулфия получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Зулфии имеется: 2 коровы, 7 овец. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Зулфия обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Зулфия планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Zulfiya is 54 years old, raising four kids. She decided to raise livestock for a living 35 years ago. Thanks to her tireless efforts and endurance, Zulfiya now turns a monthly profit of 7,000 som (KGS). In her household, there are two cows and seven sheep. To increase the livestock, Zulfiya turned to Bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy more sheep. Zulfiya plans to use the borrowed money to increase livestock headcount, as well as improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep to increase the livestock headcount

loans.name: Mityana Standard School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Edward. He is the Director of Mityana Standard School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kagavu in Mityana with 520 students. Mityana Standard School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mityana Standard School will repay their loan from the school fees, which they collect each term. Edward ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm; she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and generate more income to support her family.

loans.name: Qobil

texts.ru:
Кобил 49 летний житель славного района Спитамен. Район назвали в честь героя таджикского народа воевавший за свободу народа 329-377 годов до нашей эры. Он является эталоном таджикского народа. Кобил гордится, что живет в районе названного в честь своего любимого героя. 
Кобил семейный человек. Он женат и имеет две дочки. Они учатся в средней школе. Кобил дома занимается выращиваем скотов. На сегодняшний день это деятельность является единственным источником дохода в семью. Кобил надеется, что с финансовой поддержкой он сможет купить еще пару голов телят и расширить деятельность. Тогда его семья сможет позволить себе новые экономические возможности.
texts.en:
Qobil is 49 years old, a resident of the glorious region of Spitamen. It was named after a Tajik hero from 377-329 B.C. who was fighting for his people’s freedom. He is the role model for the Tajik people. Qobil is proud to be living in the area named after his favorite hero. 

Qobil is a family man. He is married, with two daughters. They are both in secondary school. Qobil raises livestock for a living. This is currently the only source of income for the family. Qobil hopes that with your financial assistance he can afford to buy another pair of calves to expand the business. His family would then be able to improve their economic and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy several calves

loans.name: Enilda Susana

texts.es:
Ella es Enilda es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, humilde, madre de 7 hijos perseverante, rebuscadora que tiene un humilde negocio de venta de alimento en la zona rural, se separó de su esposo y desde hace muchos años es la cabeza de familia de su hogar.

Enilda recibe ayuda de sus hijos y trabaja por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por construirla en material.

Enilde solicita un pequeño monto para la compra de yuca, Azúcar, harina, especias, con este préstamo fabricara las arepas.
texts.en:
This is Enilda. She is a determined, hard working and humble mother of 7 children. Persistent and resourceful, she has a modest business selling food in the rural area. She is separated from her husband and has been the head of her household for many years.

Enilda gets help from her children and works to improve the condition of her home and build it properly.

Enilda is seeking a small amount to help her buy yuca, sugar, flour, and with this loan she will make arepas.

loans.use: to buy yuca, sugar, flour and spices and with this loan she will make arepas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 44 years old and lives with her family in the Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. She has two sons, and both of them are hired constructors; they work around their region repairing houses and flats.

Svetlana, with her husband, runs farming. They have a great range of farm products for sale, since on the farm they have cows, calves, pigs, and chickens. From her house, Svetlana sells milk, macun (national dairy product), curd, cheese, meat, and eggs. Land cultivation is also profitable for this family, and they have a good and tasty harvest of potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers, and greens.

Svetlana mentions that her work with farm cattle and with her land keeps her young, and she feels healthy and active, so she likes her farming very much.

With this Kiva loan, Svetlana wants to buy fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya, 35 years old, lives with her two daughters and a son in Tsovagyugh village in Gegharkunik region. Zoya’s husband seasonally goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad, while she works in the village taking care of the farm. A good wife and farmer, she does her best to provide her family with good living conditions.

Zoya has cows, calves, heifers, pigs and chickens. From her farm she sells milk, macun (a national dairy-product), cheese and eggs. Her land’s vegetables and fruits (potatoes, tomatoes, peppers, greens, apples, apricots and figs) she uses mainly for her family, selling only a very small portion to her neighbors.  

With this loan of 700.000, Zoya plans to purchase another cow as well as fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase another cow for her farm and  fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. У нее - высшее образование, она знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чынара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 4 лошади. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство дома.
texts.en:
Chynara is 57 years old, married. Together with her husband they’ve raised three children. Chynara has an advanced degree, she knows what she wants and always pursues her goals. Chynara raises livestock and cultivates plants for a living. She started 30 years ago having purchased livestock for 2,000 soms (KGS). 

Thanks to her hard work, there are now four cows and four horses in Chynara’s household. Every day she sells milk. Her monthly income is 15,000 soms (KGS). To further develop her business, Chynara requested a loan though Bai Tushum Bank, for a total of 15,000 soms (KGS) to purchase three horses to increase the livestock headcount. Chynara is planning to use the borrowed money to invest in increasing her livestock, and also be able to save enough money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase three horses to increase the livestock headcount

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread and other items.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: James

texts.en:
The person in the photo is James; fifty six years old, married and blessed with five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.
He operates a cafe from which he earns his living. He is proud to have undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on record-keeping, savings, enterprise development and financial management  which he acquired skills on how to manage his business efficiently. 

He is borrowing from Kiva to enable him add stock of food stuffs such as flour, sugar and rice in his cafe in order to meet the rising demand of his products. This will help him meet his family’s basic needs and pay school fees for his children with ease.
James is happy with Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, flour and rice for the cafe to help meet customers rising demand and to be able to pay school fees

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old, married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development. 

Her main economic activity is poultry farming, as well as vegetable farming, growing cabbages and kale. She is borrowing the Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds for her poultry business to increase egg production and earn more income to pay school fees for her children. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds for her poultry to increase egg production and earn more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for an ice cream making machine owned by her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains and cashew nuts

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread, cereals and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, cereals and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, cereals and other items

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 34 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for 12 years. He will be using the loan to buy poultry feeds for his poultry, seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du JIGUISSEME 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le maïs avec DADO la personne au milieu sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter : 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de125 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called  Jiguisseme 1  are married women with an average age of 34, with on average four children. They all live in polygamous families in Kadiana, Kolondieba circle, in one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Peanuts and maize are the crops cultivated by Dado, the person in the middle of the photo, standing. With her loan, she intends to buy farm supplies, seeds and pay the fees for laborers in order to cultivate 2 hectares. Her yield is sold in Kadiana after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 125,000 F CFA which will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, seeds, and pay for workers

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es:
Luz Estella es una mujer del campo, una persona sonriente, servicial, amable que se dedica a la venta de alimentos como pasteles, arepas rellenas, empanadas, pastas de gallina, con este negocio que ubica en la carretera genera los ingresos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su hogar que lo constituyen su pareja y dos hijos.

EL negocio de estella es muy humilde solo unos palos y unos plásticos lo conforman pero en el momento es todo lo que puede pagar, ella quiere cambiar esta imagen hacerlo más agradable, pero no cuenta con el capital, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra mesas, lona, sillas e insumos, este préstamo el permitirá tener un negocio más agradable con el que podrá atraer un mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Estella is a country woman. She is a smiling, helpful and pleasant person who sells foods like pasteles (a kind of tamal), filled arepas, empanadas, and pasta with chicken. With this business, located on the highway, she makes enough income to support the household that consists of her partner and two children. 

Estella’s business is very humble. It is built of just a few posts and plastic. That will do for now, and it is all that she can afford. She would like to change this to have a better and more appealing look, but she doesn’t have the capital. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy tables, tarpaulin, chairs and supplies. This loan will allow her to have a more appealing business, which will attract a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to buy tables, tarpaulin, chairs and supplies, and with this loan, make her business more appealing.

loans.name: Eliab

texts.en:
Eliab is a repeat client married with 09 children having 2 attending school.  He is an agriculturalist dealing in cattle fattening and coffee growing. Eliab has been taking loans from Ugafode which has enabled him to educate his children and build a house. 

Eliab applied for a loan of ugx1,500,000 to buy building materials to complete his house i.e. cement and sand. Eliab thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled him to sustain him family and enabling him to build himself a house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house and also help educate his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a modern toilet facility for the health and well-being of his household.

loans.name: Jorge William

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona seria, organizada, correcta, puntual, un comerciante de 42 años de edad que se dedica a la comercialización y venta de pulpas de fruta, negocio que empezó en el año 2013 con la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vivienda de su hogar, de tener una comercializadora y trabaja mucho en ello.

A pesar del largo desplazamiento que hace de su hogar hasta llegar a sus clientes, de los altos costos de los insumos, de la competencia del sector sigue muy firme en su idea de tener una comercializadora y lo comprueba haciendo una apuesta de inversión para tomar mayor mercado.


Jorge quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en un carro de comidas dónde distribuirá comidas rápidas, un carro de ventas de helado, insumos y una nevera, está decidido quiere ser exitoso y con este préstamo puede generar empleo si lo apoyan,
texts.en:
Jorge is a responsible, organised, polite and punctual person. He is 42 years old and is a trader who markets and sells fruit purées. He started his business in 2013 with the hope of improving the living conditions of his home and having a trading company and he puts a lot of work into achieving this.
 
Despite the long journey he makes from his home to reach his customers, the high costs of supplies and the competition in this sector Jorge remains firm in his plan of having a trading company and he proves it by making a commitment to investing in order to take a greater share of the market.

Jorge is requesting a loan in order to invest in a food cart where he will sell fast food; an ice cream cart, supplies and a refrigerator. He is determined that he wants to be successful and with this loan he can create jobs if he is supported.

loans.use: to buy a food cart where he will sell fast food, an ice cream cart and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja con la que tiene un pequeño hijo de tan solo 1 año de edad, trabajador, respetuoso, se desempeña como maestro de obra, en la foto se puede ver frente a una casa que está construyendo y su sueño es en un futuro poder construir su propio hogar con sus manos.

Carlos apenas está empezando en este mundo ya tiene un contrato pero tiene una gran falencia y no es contar con herramienta propia, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo con el que abastecerá su “almacén” de herramientas.

Con el dinero solicitado comprara almadana, martillo, metro, cincel, reguladores, corta losa, mezcladora entre otros elementos, en el campo es difícil conseguirlos préstamos y para él sería un plus enorme contar con su propia herramienta.
texts.en:
Carlos is 24 years old. He lives with his partner with whom he has a small son who is only 1 year old. He is a hard worker and respectful. He works as a foreman. In the photo you can see him in front of house that he is building and his dream is to build his own home with his hands in the future. Carlos is only just beginning in this field now that he has a contract, but he faces a major challenge which is that he does not have his own tools. Because of this he wants to obtain a loan with which he can supply his "warehouse" of tools. 

With the loan he is seeking he will purchase a sledgehammer, hammer, tape measure, chisel, powerstrips, small slabs and a cement mixer, among other items. It is hard to find loans in the countryside and for Carlos it would be enormously beneficial to use his own tools.

loans.use: to purchase a sledgehammer, hammer, tape measure, chisel, powerstrips, small slabs and a cement mixer, among other items.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread,soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good place. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, cooking fat and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour,bread, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen  is a married woman having 4 children. Parveen is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. This loan will enable her  to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Parveen  closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a profit and thus pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman. She has 8 children. She describes herself to be risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells water and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of water. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a water tank. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her water business in the market

loans.name: Famille Tekeleza Group

texts.fr: Après avoir constaté auprès de ses amis d'Uvira la manière dont la riziculture est entrain d'être améliorée, Dieudonné a été intéressé et à emboiter les pas pour s'enquérir de la réalité de cette culture. Malgré les difficultés liées aux maladies de plants, les oiseaux ravageurs des épis et l'incertitude des débouchés sûrs, Dieudonné projette élargir son étendue culturale afin de gagner plus d'argent pour répondre aux besoins familiaux tels que la scolarisation, l'alimentation et les soins médicaux. Chef de la famille TEKELEZA, il est accompagné sur la photo par son épouse Bintu.
texts.en: After having learned from friends in Uvira the way rice-growing is being improved, Dieudonné became interested and hastened to discover whether this method of growing was for real. Despite the difficulties of plant diseases, birds that destroy the ears of grain, and the uncertainty of finding a market, Dieudonné has plans to expand his cultivated area in order to earn more money to respond to family needs such as school fees, food, and medical care. Head of the family Tekeleza, he is accompanied in the photo by his wife, Bintu.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plant-protection products, and pay laborers for harvesting rice

loans.name: Merki Sided

texts.es:
Merki un hombre soltero, trabajador, pujante una persona del campo de esas que trabajan para aportar su grano de arena para que miles de personas gocen de los productos del campo, él se dedica a la cría de cerdos gracias a este negocio genera los ingresos para su auto sostenimiento y no solo trabaja para pagar sus deudas quiere creces, convertir su hogar en una granja llena de animales y cultivos por eso se proyectó para mejorar sus ventas porque lo necesita.

Merki solicita un préstamo para comprar una cerda de cría, lechones y alimento de engorde, igualmente comprara semillas para iniciar con un cultivo será su paso como agricultor donde espera tener éxito y en unos años tener su tan desea granja,
texts.en:
Merki is a single, hard-working, and strong man.  He is one of those people from the country who work to contribute their grain of sand so that thousands of people may enjoy the products of the field.  He makes a living breeding pigs.  Thanks to this business, he generates income for self-sufficiency rather than solely working to pay his debts.  He wants to expand and convert his home into a farm full of animals and crops.  He projects that this will improve his sales, which he needs.  

Merki is requesting a loan to buy a breeding sow, piglets, and food for fattening, as well as to buy seeds to start a crop that will be his step toward being a farmer.   He hopes to have success with this and in a few years to have his desired farm.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow, piglets, and food for fattening, as well as to buy seeds to start a crop that will be his step toward being a farmer.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Pagar la educación de sus hijos, comprar vivienda propia son los sueños Ricardo un hombre que se dedica a la cría de ganado, su actividad principal es la producción de leche, una actividad que de momento sufre una crisis debido a la baja de precios de venta de leche.

Para afrontar esta adversidad Ricardo quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheros y un toro ya que tiene que reducir costos, antes gestaba las vacas por filtración in vito, ahora le toca a lo tradicional.
texts.en: Ricardo, a man who works raising cattle, dreams of paying for his children's education and purchasing his own home. His primary activity is the production of milk, an activity that is suffering from a crisis at the moment because of the decrease in the price of commercial milk. To confront this adversity, Ricardo is seeking a loan to purchase milk cows and a bull because he has to reduce costs. Previously he impregnated cows via in vitro methods, but now he is using the traditional method.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows and a bull because he has to reduce costs. Previously he impregnated cows via in vitro methods, but now he is using the traditional method.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys viene de una familia muy trabajadora,  su marido al igual que ella trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo. 
Su meta es terminar sus estudios y poder trabajar en lo que es su carrera,  es decir en la enfermería, para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y así poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder estudiar.
texts.en: Gladys comes from a hard working family. Her husband, like her, works and studies at the same time. Her goal is to complete her studies and to be able to work in her chosen career, which is nursing, so she can help other people. Gladys is a very strong woman who wants to get ahead and is asking for this loan to pay the fees for her degree so she can continue with her studies like she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to study.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Teresio

texts.es:
Teresio es de la ciudad de San Pedro, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, cursando el quinto semestre.
Comenta que su meta es ser un profesional y trabajar de manera independiente, quiere ayudar a su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida, y poder darles todo lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios, poniendo todo de sí para poder cumplir con su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Teresio is from the city of San Pedro. He is studying a Law career, completing the fifth semester. He says his goal is to be a professional and work independently. He wants to help his family to have a better quality of life and be able to give them everything they need.

He is asking for this loan to pay this career fees and thus be able to continue with his studies, giving his all in order to meet his goal of being somebody in life.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
La  Srta.  Ventura tiene 27 años de edad, comenta que de muy joven empezó a trabajar como empleada en un negocio, pasado dos años juntó un poco de capital para poder empezar su propio negocio que es la ventas de ropas en general y así poder generar más ganancia ya que su sueldo como empleada era muy poco, actualmente ya tiene clientela formada.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra calzados deportivos, Remeras, Jeans entre otros ya que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ventura is 27 years old, and says that when she was very young she began work as an employee in a business. After two years she saved a small amount of capital that she was able to use to start her own business selling clothes. With her business she was able to make more money as her salary as an employee was very low, nowadays she has a good customer base. 

Ventura is seeking this loan to buy sports shoes, t-shirts, jeans and other products, it is now the season when her customers are seeking these kind of items.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes, t-shirts, jeans and other products to sell.

loans.name: Diego Orlando

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 32 años de edad, se encuentra desempleado, tiene una familia y necesita mantenerla, es una persona que no le gusta las excusas por ello quiere contrarrestar su situación, se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio para mantener a su familia que será la cría de aves y cerdos.

Por ello con el propósito de mantener a su familia, Diego quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la construcción de las cocheras,  comprar cerdos, pollos y alimento.

Este préstamo será la oportunidad para que esta persona genere el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a 32 year old man, he is currently unemployed and has a family who he needs to support. 

Diego is a man that doesn't like excuses and so he wants to push back against his circumstances. He is seeking a loan to start his own business to support his family. The business will be raising poultry and pigs, with the goal of being able to support his family. 

Diego will use the loan to start his business by investing in materials for the construction of pens, pigs, chickens and feed. 

This loan will be an opportunity for Diego to make enough money to take care of his family.

loans.use: to start his business by investing in materials for the construction of pens, pigs, chickens and feed.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número (2º) del programa de comité de jóvenes, donde todos tienen la esperanza de poder trabajar en alguna actividad para poder ayudar a sus familias y sentirse útiles.
Monica es niñera, y una de las integrantes de este grupo, está trabajando y estudiando al mismo tiempo, comenta que pide este préstamo para usar en materiales de estudios y agradece por esta oportunidad de crecer.
texts.en:
The group Renacer is now in it's second loan cycle in the program Comité de Jóvenes (Youth Committee). The group members share 
the desire to be able to work in something that will help their families and make them feel useful. Monica is one of the members of this group, she works as a nanny, she is studying and working at the same time. 

Monica says that she is seeking this loan to buy study materials and she is thankful for this opportunity to develop.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Pablo Marcelino

texts.es:
Pablo es un joven de 21 años de edad que está dando sus pasos como empresario, inicio con una venta de pollos con la idea de generar recursos para su auto sostenimiento y de momento lleva ya un año donde se está consolidando, se está adaptando a la forma de trabajar y ve que tiene una gran falencia y es la fuerte competencia que ganan contratos o ventas por precios.

Pablo no quiere dejarse vencer, piensa luchar a su manera, trabajando honestamente y dando pollos de calidad, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos y alimento de engorde, pues cada pollo tiene la consigna de que son alimentados únicamente con cuido y maíz.
 Apoya a este joven para que crezca y se convierta en un fuerte empresario avícola de la vereda
texts.en:
Pablo is a 21 year old young man who is starting on his path as an entrepreneur. He started with his chicken sales with the goal of generating income for his own sustenance. Currently, he has spent a year becoming stronger and he is adapting to this method of work. He knows that he faces a major challenge which is the strong competition to win contracts, or sales prices. 

Pablo does not want to give up and he is fighting in his own way by working honestly and providing quality chickens. He wants to obtain a loan to purchase chickens and feed to fatten them  because he has a slogan that they are only fed with care and corn.  Please support this young man so that he will grow and become a strong poultry businessman from his village.

loans.use:
to purchase chickens and feed to fatten them  because he has a slogan that they are only fed with care and corn. 

compra de pollos y alimento de engorde, pues cada pollo tiene la consigna de que son alimentados únicamente con cuido y maíz.

loans.name: Liz Carmenza

texts.es:
Carmenza es una mujer de 30 años de edad, cariñosa y tierna, trabaja en a la cría de cerdos gracias a este profesión puede generar el sustento para su familia que la conforman dos hombres de 12 y 5 años de edad, ellos se encuentra estudiando y todo gracias a su madre.

Carmenza trabaja por sus hijos y pro un gran sueño que es tener  una casa propia, algo que dejarles a sus hijos de herencia esto es algo que le da fortaleza para salir a trabajar todos los días.

Con la intención de abastecer sus cocheras y construir una nueva, Carmenza quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento y madera para construir las cocheras.
texts.en: Carmenza is a 30 year old woman. She is caring and tender. She works raising pigs and thanks to this profession she is able to generate sustenance for her family which is made up of two boys who are 12 and 5 years old. They are both studying, all thanks to their mother. Carmenza works for the benefit of her sons and in pursuit of a big dream which is to have her own home, something she could leave to her sons as an inheritance. This is something that gives her the strength to leave to work everyday. With the intent of supplying her pens and building a new one, Carmenza is seeking a loan to purchase pigs, feed and wood to construct her pens.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and wood to construct the pens.

loans.name: Kaleema

texts.en:
Kaleema  is 40 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband(who is also shown in the photo) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas se unieron y trabajan todas unidas para poder ir superando su situación de pobreza y con ello ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bernardina quien se destaca por ser una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada, que quiere dar a su familia los medios para poder crecer y salir adelante. Bernardina tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano para poder empezar con su negocio y sus ventas, comenta que con esfuerzo está creciendo y saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con productos varios, como ser verduras, carne, panificados, bebidas y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del programa.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Encarnación. They joined together and work together to improve their situations of poverty and doing this help their families.

One of the members is Bernardina who stands out being a fighter and demanding person who wants to have her family grow and her ahead by any means. Bernardina has a store where she works every day from very early to be able to open her business and her sales. She comments that with effort she is growing and getting ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to stock her store with various items like vegetables, meat bakery products, drinks and others so she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions through this program.

loans.use: to buy vegetables. meat, bakery goods, drinks and others.

loans.name: Monedas Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Sonia Alexa, Reina Isabel y Aracely Celina), que se organizaron hace un año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Reina Isabel. Es integrante del grupo solidario Monedas. Es una joven de 29 años de edad, afable, casada con 2 hijas: La mayor de 13 años cursa su segundo año de secundaria y una menor de edad. Su esposo, recientemente encontró un empleo formal, desempeñándose como técnico de proyectos, anteriormente trabajaba de manera informal, como albañil. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de su hija, desde hace un año estableció una pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Con los 3 créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus productos al vender de manera ambulante cosméticos y productos de belleza, elaborar fritos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero y establecer una carnicería.
texts.en:
It consists of three determined women (Sonya Alexa, Reina Isabel and Aracely Celina), who organized their group a year ago in order to access funding for their small businesses, increase their income and improve their living conditions, cover their family’s basic needs, ensure their children’s education and expand their businesses.  

Reina Isabel is a member of the solidarity group ‘Monedas’ (or coins). She is 29 years old, good-humored, and married with 2 daughters: the older one is 13 and in her second year of secondary school, the other is younger. 

Her husband recently found a formal job working as a project technician. Previously he worked informally as a mason. 

In order to contribute to household expenses and her daughter’s education, a year ago she set up a grocery store in the veranda of her house, which is made of wood and sits on stilts.  

With the three loans granted by PANA PANA and funded by KIVA, they have been able to diversify products, to sell cosmetics and beauty products, and to prepare fried food. 

She is requesting this loan to buy grains, dairy and other products. She dreams of having a thriving business and establishing a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy grains, dairy and other products.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma es de la ciudad de Luque, es viuda, tiene 52 años, es comerciante, tiene un copetín hace 6 años, tiene buena clientela, ya formada.
Comenta que con  mucho esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y abriéndose camino, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que le gustaría poder crecer aún más en su negocio, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para usar en su copetín, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Norma is from the city of Luque. She is a widow, 52 years old, and a businesswoman. She has had a small food counter and store for 6 years. She has good clientele, already built. 

She says that, with lots of effort, she has been improving and making her way. She is a very hardworking woman and a fighter who would like to grow further in her business, which is why she puts in her best effort.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of inputs to use in her small food counter and store, such as vegetables, meat, seasoning, and others in order to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, seasoning, and other inputs to use in a small food counter and store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Alicia es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casada y comenta que su marido y sus hijos son transportista.  La señora tiene un negocio de ropería y mercerías en general, comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 10 años. Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en: Alicia is from the city of Encarnación. She is married and comments that her husband and her children work in transportation. She has a clothing and dry-goods business. She says that through her work she helps her husband with the household expenses. She has had this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting this loan to buy various clothing so she can continue to work as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments for sale.

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” es grupo conformado por mujeres trabajadoras dedicadas al comercio minorista. Jusmeri tiene 27 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedicada a la producción y venta de tejidos a base de lana e hilo desde hace dos años. Elabora champa para niños y adultos. Y a la vez presta servicios domésticos  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más lana e hilo para la producción de sus tejidos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jusmeri es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en: The SEÑOR DEL RIMAC is made up of dedicated, hardworking small businesswomen.  Jusmeri is 27 years old, single, and has a son.  She makes and sells wool weavings for children and adults and has for two years.  She also does domestic chores.  She will use the money from this loan to buy yarn and thread to make her knittings.  This group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Jusmeri is the first from the left.

loans.use: to buy yarn and thread.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is a 43 year old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son. She deals in the business of selling animals with the support of her son. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve their business to bear their household expenses. For this reason, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 25000 to purchase more cattle to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to increase her earnings so as to better support the needs of the family

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for her cows to improve yield

loans.name: Mburukuja Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mburukuja es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Zunilda, quien es una persona muy emprendedora, y quien se esfuerza para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Zunilda se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de trabajos y es muy conocida por un excelente trabajo, ella quiere ir mejorando cada día en su trabajo, es por ello que pone su mayor entusiasmo para hacerlo.
Zunilda pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mburukuja group is a new group in it's first loan cycle. All the members are in the Poverty Stoplight Program.

Amongst them Zunilda stands out. She is a very enterprising person who is making the effort to be able to improve her living conditions. Zunilda works sewing. She does all kinds of sewing and is well-known for her excellent work. She wants to improve her work each day so she applies great enthusiasm to achieve this. Zunilda is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread so she can continue her work as she has been doing. She has many requests and she wants to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy starch, cheese, anise, butter and other ingredients for making chipa (rolls)

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 54 years old, married, and blessed with seven children. She is a farmer who grows cash crops such as maize, beans, and vegetables to sell. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income, and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dúo Concepción De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: Dúo Concepción de Villa Nueva. este grupo esta conformado por la señora Berta Marilia de 40 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz, para seguir creciendo en su negocio espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito Solicitado.
texts.en: Concepción de Villa Nueva Duo includes 40 year old Berta Marilia. She makes and sells tortillas and has been doing so for several years.  She is asking for this loan to buy dried corn so she can grow her business.  She hopes that you will help her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy dried corn.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Los Angeles” está en su 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4  de las 21 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes, la Sra. Petrona, quien se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, es una persona muy activa en el grupo y pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Ella comenta que tiene muchos clientes y pedidos, y que por eso pide este préstamo, para la compra de productos para la venta por catálogo.
Ella es una mujer que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The “Los Angeles” group is in their 3rd cycle with the women's committee, where everyone promises to work and help each other so that they can all move forward.  They are all participating in the poverty elimination survey.  Four of the 21 women were found to be below the poverty line, which means extreme poverty.  

Petrona is a member of the group who works selling products by catalog.  She is active in the group and makes her greatest effort to be able to grow and move forward.  She says she has many customers and orders.  She is requesting this loan to purchase products to sell by catalog.  

She is a woman that makes every effort to be able to grow and improve every day.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to become someone.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell by catalog.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase meat, drinks, bread products, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pyapy Mbarete está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas ven una gran oportunidad en el programa de comité de mujeres, ya que todas ellas están ansiosas de poder capacitarse por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien se destaca por ser una persona muy luchadora y emprendedora, que pone su esfuerzo para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y de esa forma evitar que pase por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Ana es empleada doméstica, y también vende bebidas como una forma de poder tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ana pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias, como ser vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y otros, para que ella pueda seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar cada día. Agradece por esta oportunidad de ir creciendo con su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The "Pyapy Mbarete" communal bank is participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" program. They see a great opportunity in the "Comité de Mujeres" (Women's Committee) program, and they are anxious to get trained to improve their situations.

One of communal bank members is Sra. Ana. She stands out as a hard-working and enterprising person. She works hard to give her family everything she, herself, wasn't able to have so she can keep them from suffering the same needs that she suffered. Ana works as a maid and also sells beverages as a way to increase her income and help her family.

Ana is asking for this loan so she can purchase various beverages, such as wine, beer and sodas among others. That way she will be able to continue working and try to improve her situation each day. Ana is grateful for this opportunity to keep growing through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase various beverages for resale, such as wine, beer, sodas among others.

loans.name: Fresa Roja Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras (Dora Rosario, Rosa Maricela, Cindy Alsira y Lucia Auxiliadora), viven en  Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace 6 meses se organizaron en grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de verduras y ropa usada, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. 

Lucia Auxiliadora: Es nueva integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven cordial, luchadora de 23 años, madre soltera  de una pequeña niña de 2 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en un tramo que alquila, pagando mensualmente C$2,000(Dos mil Córdobas Netos). Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada mixta y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela en Bilwi. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of 4 enterprising women. (Dora Rosario, Rosa Maricela, Cindy Alsira and Lucia Auxiliadora). They live in Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Six months ago they organized their communal bank with the goal of working together to access loans from Pana Pana. They want the opportunity to improve their small businesses selling vegetables and used clothing, improve their income and also the quality of living of their families.

Lucia Auxiliadora: is a new member of the group. She is a 23 year old friendly youth and a fighter. She is the single mother of a 2 year old daughter. With the goal of progressing with her family. She started to sell used clothing one year ago in a space she is renting paying 2,000 NIO per month. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bale of mixed used clothing in Managua to sell at accessible prices to her clients in Bilwi. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a bale of mixed used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
Agneta is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, fruits, coconuts, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, and fruits. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, and fruits.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Ñepytyvo lo que quiere decir ayuda mutua, y es exactamente el motivo por el que ellas se unieron, para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
Una persona que se destaca por su entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante, es la Sra. Benigna, quien se define como una persona humilde, y que quiere salir adelante. Ella vende joyas variadas, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia una vida digna, quiere que a través del programa de comités, vaya capacitándose para mejorar.
Hoy pide este préstamo para la compra de joyas variadas, y de esa forma poder ir mejorando en su plan de negocios, y procurar por mejorar y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Ñepytyvo," which means mutual help. And that is the exact reason they got together; to help one another to improve their own and their families' standards of living.

One person who stands out because of her enthusiasm and desire to get ahead is Sra. Benigna. She is known as a humble person who wants to get ahead. Sra. Benigna sells a variety of jewelry. Through her work, she is able to give her family a dignified life. She wants to keep learning to improve her situation through the Committee's program.

Sra. Benigna is currently asking for a loan to purchase a variety of jewelry so she can keep improving her business plan. She will then be able to improve her situation and make her customers happy.

loans.use: to purchase a variety jewelery for resale.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 36 years old and is from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has four children. The only source of income for the family is a carpentry project.

Abdullah wishes to expand his project to attract more customers and increase his sales. So, he requested a 3,000 EGP loan to buy more wood and an electric saw.

loans.use: to buy wood and an electric saw.

loans.name: Noviembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Andrea, Lizeth Ivania y Nazaria) de la etnia miskita, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de chiverías y artesanía; se organizaron hace 2 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA le permitieron incrementar sus inventarios de los productos que ofertan en sus pequeños negocios.

Nazaria: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora emprendedora de 65 años, originaria de la comunidad de KAMLA, que se localiza a 10 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casada, tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 3 años vende fritos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, vigoron y enchiladas en el cafetín de una de las universidades de Bilwi, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar sus productos. Ella sueña con establecer una panadería y ofertar reposterías tradicionales de región.
texts.en:
This loan group is made up of three women members (Andrea, Lizeth Ivania and Nazaria) of Miskito ethniciity, from the town of Puerto Cabezas.  They are enterprising women who struggle daily to grow their  businesses selling food and craft items.  They formed their organization two months ago to access loans with a joint guarantee in Pana Pana.  The first loan granted by Pana Pana and financed by KIVA  allowed them to increase the inventory of products they offer in their small businesses.

Nazaria is a member of the group, an enterprising 65 year old woman, from the community of Kamla, which is 10 kilometers from Puerto Cabezas.  Nazaria is married; she has six adult children.  For three years she has sold fried foods, soft drinks, juices, vigoron and enchiladas in a small cafe at a university in Bilwi.  In this way she helps with household expenditures.  She is asking for her second loan to buy raw materials and ingredients to make her products.  Nazaria dreams of starting a bakery and offering traditional pastries of the area.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients for making fried food, juices, vigoron and enchiladas

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: RAMONA: Es una señora sonriente y amable de 42 años de edad. Originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Trabaja como enfermera auxiliar Su casa es de madera y  actualmente se encuentra bastante deteriorada.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para reparar su vivienda. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y pagar la mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa bonita de cemento, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y ambiente para toda su familia.
texts.en: RAMONA is a smiling and friendly 42 year old woman. She is a native of Waspam Rio Coco, and belongs to the Miskito ethic group. She works as a nursing aide. Her house is built of wood and currently is in poor condition. So she is requesting a loan to buy planed wood, wooden posts, nails and pay for labor. She and her husband dream of having a pretty cement house with the best security and environment for the whole family.

loans.use: to repair her wooden house on stilts.

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik is 29 years old and lives in Ijevan city in Tavush region with his wife, two nice daughters, and his parents. With this partnership, the number of his Kiva and Nor Horizon deals will already be five. As he mentions, he is sure that this partnership also will be profitable for him.

Radik still manages both his taxi services and also takes care of his farm; he has cows, piglets, sheep, and chickens. The sale of farm products (milk, meat, and eggs) and the income from taxi driving are the source of covering his big family’s needs.

This time with a Kiva loan, Radik wants to enlarge the number of his farm cattle and buy pigs, a bull, and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy pigs, a bull, and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité  MUJERES UNIDAS, este es un grupo nuevo que se formó en la ciudad de Santaní, entre ellas se destaca a la señora Blasida, por ser muy trabajadora, cuenta con un kiosco en su casa, allí atiende desde tempranas horas ofreciendo ya deliciosas minutas a los trabajadores del lugar, en horas de la tarde-noche también vende bebidas heladas.
Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que pone todo de su para poder capacitarse y mejorar. 
Blasida pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su kiosco, como ser comestibles, jugos, golosinas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is a new group in the city of Santaní.  Blasida is an outstanding member because she is very hardworking, has a food stand in her home, and from early in the day offers delicious fast food to the local workers.  In the afternoon and evening, she also sells cold drinks.  Blasida is happy to have this opportunity, since she does everything within her power to become capable in business and to improve. Blasida is seeking this loan  to buy food, juices, snacks and other items, so she can continue with her sales in the same way.

loans.use: to buy food, juices, snacks and other items to stock a food stand

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se formó en la ciudad de Lambaré, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo unido y en conjunto. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Elsa, es una  las integrantes quien está dentro del comité para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Ella se dedica a la costura y comenta que por medio de este humilde trabajo tiene los medios para ofrecer a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones. 
Elsa se unió a este grupo con el propósito de poder mejorar cada día con su trabajo. Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] was formed in the city of Lambaré. They are female heads of household who want to improve their living conditions through united and joint work. They are in the poverty eradication program.

Elsa is one of the members, who is on the committee to be able to grow and improve her living conditions and that of her family. She is in sewing and says that through this humble work, she has the means to offer her loved ones a dignified life without hardship.

Elsa joined this group with the purpose of being able to improve each day with her work. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics, thread, and other inputs in order to continue with her tailoring. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives to be able to improve to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and others for tailoring.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa: Es originaria de Waspam; es una señora emprendedora, tiene 31 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Desde hace dos años vende de manera ambulante ropa y calzado, con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua ropa interior, pantalones, camisas y en Masaya zapatos, sandalias, entre otros productos y venderla a precios accesible a su clientela de Waspam Rio Coco y comunidades cercanas. Su sueño es llegar a  tener un negocio prospero que le permita tener mejores ingresos y así poder vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: María Teresa is a native of Waspam.  She is an enterprising woman who is 31-years old, married and has three children.  Two of her children are adolescents and go to primary school, and the youngest is 4-years old.  For two years, María Teresa has sold clothing and shoes as a street vendor.   Her goal is to have her own source of income to help with the household expenses and her children's education.  She is requesting the loan to purchase undergarments, pants and shirts in Managua and shoes, sandals and other items in Masaya.  She will sell her products at affordable prices to her clientele in Waspam, Rio Coco and nearby communities.  María Teresa's dream is to one day have a prosperous business that allows her to have a better income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, pants and shirts in Managua and shoes, sandals and other products in Masaya.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, sodas, juices, instant soups, and other products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman who has one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes and other items. She has been in business for three years. It is located in a strategic place. 

Gladys says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more clothes, shoes and other items to resell. This is her second loan with SMEP micro finance bank.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and other items to resell.

loans.name: Lencer

texts.en:
Lencer is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as competent. 

Lencer has operated a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread, juices and other items for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. 

Lencer says her biggest business challenge is lack of stock. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more sbread, flour, sugar, juices and other items. Her goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more bread, flour, sugar, juices and other items.

loans.name: Phylicia

texts.en: Phylicia is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions, fruits, coconuts and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and fruits. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and fruit

loans.name: Denis Frank

texts.es: DENIS FRANK: Es originario de Waspam Río Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita; es un hombre trabajador, tiene 43 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 7 años de edad, cursa su primer grado de primaria. Trabaja en una institución del gobierno central. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita su primer préstamo para mejorar su vivienda que es de  madera y tambo. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en:
Denis Frank is a native of Waspam Río Coco.  He is ethnically Miskita.  Denis Frank is a hard-working man who is 43-years old, married and has one 7-year old son.  He works in a central governmental institution.  
Denis Frank wants to make improvements to his home and have a dignified and safe home for his family.  He is requesting the loan to improve his wooden house that is on stilts.  He wants to use the loan to buy construction materials, wood, zinc and nails, and to cover the labor costs.  
Denis Frank's dream is to one day have a concrete (cement) home, because it would be more durable.

loans.use: to make improvements to his wooden house on stilts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilizer her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizers to boost productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, insecticides and herbicides to increase production.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 33 years old and a mother of three school-aged children. Susanna, her children, and parents-in-law, live in the frontier village of Gandzakar in the Tavush region. Her husband regularly works abroad in the Russian Federation and brings money home for his big family's needs. Meanwhile, Susanna in the village is busy with the care of their farm. Here she has cows, calves, pigs and chickens. On her plot of land she cultivates potato, tomato, cucumber and greens. During the week, she sells all her farm products at the city’s wholesale market. Susanna would like to enlarge her farm’s meat sale, since pork is in great demand among her customers. So this loan she will use for the purchase of a pig and for fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to adopt modern farming technologies to improve family's living standard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease land and produce more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Pagar la educación de sus hijos es el gran reto que se trazó Josefa una mujer del campo que se dedica a la cría de cerdos, tiene tres hermosas hijas menores de edad todas a las cuales les quiere dar una buena calidad de vida y un estudio digno.

Josefa se las ha arreglado junto con su esposo para que su familia tenga una buena calidad de vida y ella quiere seguir pro esa buena senda y mantener la ilusión viva de sus hijas de estudiar y prepararse para no vivir una vida en el campo.

Josefa quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde para cerdos, los cerdos de Josefa son muy apetecidos ya que solo son alimentados con cuido les da un excelente sabor y son muy gordos.
texts.en:
Paying for her children's education is the big challenge that Josefa has taken on.

She is a countrywoman, who earns a living raising pigs. She has three beautiful underage daughters, to whom she wants to give a good quality of life and a decent education.

Josefa and her husband have managed to provide their family with a good quality of life, and Josefa wants to continue doing this. She wants to keep alive her daughters' hopes of getting a good education so that they don't have to live their lives in the countryside.

Josefa wants to request a loan to buy feed for fattening pigs. 

Josefa's pigs are in high demand because she feeds them with care; they have an excellent flavour; and they are very fat.

loans.use: to buy feed for fattening pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a toilet facility in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of sachet water.

loans.name: Sitan's Group

texts.fr:
Zeni est la femme qui a les deux mains posés sur les béliers.
Zeni est une paysanne Malienne âgée de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants deux filles et deux garçons.
Ces enfants sont âgés de 4 mois à 9 ans dont deux qui ont l’âge d’être scolarisé vont à l’école. Zeni a été déscolarisée après son mariage.
Son mari cultive la terre et fait du maraichage pour gagner sa vie.
Elle mène emboucheur ovine il y a 4ans de cela. Comme toujours elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux et revend dans les mêmes marchés.
Elle fait recourt aux services financiers de l’IMF (RMCR) pour soutenir son activité d’embouche ovine à travers l’achat des moutons maigres, son du mil, aliment bétail, les médicaments.
Le but recherché est de mieux s’organiser et générer beaucoup plus de profit pour le bien être de ses petits enfants (Habillement, nourriture, santé, éducation). 
Son bénéfice périvisuel mensuellement est de 10 000FCFA
texts.en:
Zeni is the woman with both hands resting on the rams. She is a Malian peasant farmer, 31 years old, and the married mother of four children (2 girls and 2 boys). These children, aged 4 months to 9 years, of whom two are school-aged and attending school. Zeni was taken out of school after her marriage. Her husband farms the land and has a market garden to earn his living. 

Zeni has been fattening sheep for four years. As always, her supplies are gotten from the local markets and are resold at the same markets. 

She has turned to the financial services of the microfinance institution RMCR to support her business fattening sheep through the purchase of underweight sheep, millet bran, animal feed, and medicines. The sought-after goal is to be better organized and to generate much more profit for the sake of her children’s well-being (clothing, food, healthcare, education). Her projected monthly profit is 10,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to purchase rams (plus animal feed, and medicine) to raise and resell later

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe MOUGNOU sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  45 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide avec SALI 2ème personne assise sur la photo de la droite à la gauche. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter : 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group MOUGNOU  are married women, who average 45 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in KADIANA, in Cercle de KOLONDIEBA, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are now on their 5th loan with the institution; the past loans have indeed been paid back.  

The crops grown are: rice and peanuts, as is the case with SALI, who is the person sitting second from the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for making use of:  2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in KADIANA. She plans on making a profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for the growing season

loans.name: Syprine

texts.en:
Syprine is 31 years old, married and supports a family of five members. 

She has been selling soft drinks in the area for the last seven years earning KES 12,000 per month. 

Syprine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a new refrigerator, which she will use to keep her stock cold for her clients' demands.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot for rental construction for more gain.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: MIRNA: Es una mujer miskita originaria de Waspam Río Coco; es emprendedora, cuenta con 25 años de experiencia de ser comerciante ambulante. Tiene 52 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos mayores de edad. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para construir su cocina de concreto, con el préstamo comprara: cemento, bloques, hierro, zinc, clavos, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una vivienda bonita y segura.
texts.en:
Mirna is a Miskito woman native to Waspam Río Coco.  She is enterprising, and has 25 years of experience being a traveling merchant.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 7 grown children.

She is requesting her first loan to build her kitchen out of concrete.  With the loan she will purchase cement, blocks, iron, zinc, nails, and wood, and cover costs of labor.  She dreams of having a nice and safe home.

loans.use: to build her kitchen out of concrete.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka, who is 51 years old, lives in Terjola district. He has a high school education and works for one of the local government parties. He has a stay at home wife, one student and one school-aged daughter. The family members are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they take care of 3 sheep and sell lambs at the local market. Also, Mamuka has 1000 grape vines that he harvests seasonally. As the agricultural business is very profitable in this region, Mamuka wants to expand it and has requested financial support from local credit providers. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 5300 GEL and start dairy farming. 
Mamuka will purchase 2 milk cows and start producing milk-products for selling locally and for use by his family. They will get an additional and significant source of income, that will help Mamuka more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. 
Mamuka is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase 2 milk cows and start dairy farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal, 33 years old, is from Baniswef. He is married and has one daughter. Since his father's death, he has been caring for his sick and old mother. He has a small accessories sales project and wants to buy a refrigerator to sell fizzy drinks and a glass front for his shop to increase his income for his family and afford medication for his mother. So, he requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy the glass front for his shop and the refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a glass front for his shop and a refrigerator

loans.name: Gilnigor

texts.ru: Ее зовут Гилнигор. Ей 37 лет. Она веселая и жизнелюбивая женщина и мать двоих детей. Она замужем. Ее муж рабочий строитель. Детям 10 и 12 лет, они учатся в средней школе. Гилнигор занимается продажей тканей для шитья одежды. Таджикские женщины больше предпочитают купить понравившуюся ткань и дать на шитье портнихе.
