Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dahiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dahiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим, 34 года, замужем. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем в средней школе, также занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мээрим, на сегодняшний день у нее есть корова, лошадь, 5 овец. На земельном участке мерою 1,74 Га собственной земли выращивает фасоль. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Мээрим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, топлива для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Мээрим является участником группы "Эркиндик", в которой всего состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Meerim is 34 years old, married. She has a college education and, to provide the primary income for her family, works as a teacher at a secondary school and is also involved in raising livestock and in farming. Thanks to Meerim's hard work, today she has a cow, horse and 5 sheep. She grows beans on 1.74 hectares of land. All of her businesses yield a monthly profit in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Meerim requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers, fuel for cultivating the land and growing organic beans. Meerim is a member of the Arkindik group that consists of only 3 people. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fuel for cultivating the land and growing organic beans

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Mansir

texts.en: Mansir is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabon Gida Village. Mansir joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Mansir suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Mansir has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize this year, Mansir can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea seedlings for planting in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more tea produce for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Mohamed K.

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has five children who are 10, 7, 6, 3 and 2 years old. Three of them are school-going. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to be fostered.  

In 2005, Mohamed established his bags, jeans, sportwear, etc. business. He began his business because he obtained an Arabic education and later joined his elder brother in his business.  After gaining some business experience, his brother gave him some money to start his own business. He then started selling underwear and bags with the profit. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,180,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy dozens of underwear, vests, boxers, bags, shirts, polos, jeans, etc.  In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his children and reinvest and expand his business.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of underwear, vests, boxers, bags, shirts, polos, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase printers and electrical items

loans.name: Ashirbu

texts.ru: Аширбу, 54 года, замужем, есть 3 сыновей и 2 дочери. У Аширбу среднее образование, уже 30 лет она занимается животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Аширбу есть 4 коровы, 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход Аширбу составляет в среднем 13,000 сомов (KGS). Аширбу очень трудолюбива и ответственна. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит 8 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Аширбу увеличить ее хозяйство и дать достойное образование детям.
texts.en: Ashirbu is 54 years old, married and has 3 sons and 2 daughters. Ashirbu has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for 30 years. Today, Ashirbu's farm contains 4 cows and 40 sheep. Ashirbu's average monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). Ashirbu is very hardworking and responsible. She requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 8 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the loan will allow Ashirbu to grow her farm and provide a decent education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount
